en: Some 5,000 people will attend the sold-out concert for Spanish indie band Love of Lesbian, and will not be required to observe social distancing.
tsn: Batho ba le 5,000 ba tlaa tsenela konsarata e ditekethe tsa yona di rekilweng tsotlhe ya bente ya kwa Spain, Love of Lesbian mme ga ba kitla ba tlhoka go ela tlhoko melawana ya go katogana.

en: Attendees will have to wear face masks throughout the concert in the Palau Sant Jordi arena.
tsn: Batlakonsarateng ba tlaa tshwanelwa ke go apara dimaseke ka nako ya konsarata kwa Palau Sant Jordi arena.

en: (This concert) is about the excitement of going out, consuming culture, and dancing in a more or less safe environment, said Sebastian, 47, a teacher getting tested ahead of the concert.
tsn: (Konsarata e) Ke ya go itumelela go tswela kwa ntle, go itemogela tsa setso, le go bina mo lefelong le le sireletsegileng, go bua Sebastian, 47, morutabana yo o tsereng diteko pele ga konsarata.

en: We’re going to dance and have a great time.
tsn: Re tlile go bina le go nna le nako e e itumedisang.

en: The pilot concert, which has been approved by health authorities, will serve as a test for whether similar events will be able to start up again.
tsn: Khonserata ya go ithuta, e e rebotsweng ke bothati jwa boitekanelo, e tlaa dira jaaka teko ya bona gore a meletlo e e tshwanang le eno e tla kgona go simolola gape.

en: It will be safer to be in the Palau Sant Jordi than walking down the street, concert co-organiser Jordi Herreruela told Reuters.
tsn: Go tla nna le pabalesego go ya kwa Palau Sant Jordi go na le go tsamaya mo mebileng, morulaganyi wa dikonsarata Jordi Herreruela o boleletse Reuters

en: Pre-concert testing was offered at three locations in Barcelona, and carried out by 80 nurses wearing full personal protective equipment.
tsn: Tseo ya diteko pele ga konsarata e ne e le kwa mafelong a le mararo kwa Barcelona, le go dirwa ke baoki ba ba ka nnang 80 ka palo, ba apere diaparo tsa tshireletso tse di feletseng.

en: Some people winced as nurses swabbed their noses.
tsn: Batho ba bangwe ba ne ba sisimoga fa baoki ba tsenya dilo tsa go dira diteko mo dinkong tsa bona.

en: By midday, of the 2,400 people already screened, three had tested positive and one had come into contact with a positive case, Dr Josep Maria Libre, one of the doctors overseeing the testing, told Reuters.
tsn: Fa go fitlha nako ya motshegare, mo go ba le 2,400 ba batho ba setseng ba tlhatlhobilwe, ba le bararo ba fitlhetswe ba na le mogare mme yo mongwe o ne a nnile le kgolagano le mongwe yo o nang le mogare, ngaka Josep Maria Libre, mongwe wa dingaka tse di okametseng go dirwa ga diteko, o boleletse Reuters.

en: They would not be able to attend the concert and would get a refund.
tsn: Ba ka se kgone go tsenela konsarata mme ba tlaa busediwa madi a bona.

en: Attendees received the results of their antigen tests in 10 to 15 minutes via an app on their phones.
tsn: Batlakonsarateng ba amogetse dipholo tsa ditlhatlhobo tsa bone mo metsotsong e le 10 go ya go e le 15 ka app mo megaleng ya bona

en: The test and a mask were included in the ticket price.
tsn: Teko le maseke di ne di akareditswe mo tlhotlhweng ya tekethe.

en: People have understood perfectly the measures were adopting, said co-organiser Dani Poveda.
tsn: Batho ba tlhalogantse sentle ditsela tse di ba neng ba di itseela, go buile mothusa morulaganyi Dani Poveda.

en: It is a very responsible audience We know everyone will be looking at this concert as a possible model for how to keep advancing in the fight against the pandemic, which has caused so much damage, both to our sector and many others.
tsn: Ke batlakonsarateng ba ba nang le maikarabelo, re a itse gore mongwe le mongwe o tlaa be a lebile konsarata eno jaaka tsela ya go bona gore re ka tswelela jang go lwa kgatlhanong le leroborobo, le leng bakileng ditshenyegelo mo lephateng la rona le a mangwe a le mantsi.

en: Surviving COVID-19 does not end with one being declared negative.
tsn: Go fenya COVID-19 ga go felele fela fa diteko tsa gago di bontsha gore ga o na mogare.

en: According to healthcare workers and those who survived this pandemic, it takes longer for some patients to recover from the psychological effects of the virus.
tsn: Go ya ka badiri ba tlhokomelo ya boitekanelo le ba ba falotseng Leroborobo leno, go tsaya nako e telele gore balwetse ba bangwe ba fenye ditlamorago tsa go emega go tlhaloganyong tse di bakwang ke mogare.

en: Some continue to experience mild symptoms, others get depressed, while stigma also makes it worse.
tsn: Bangwe ba tswelela go itemogela matshwao a a botsatsa, ba bangwe ba nna le kgatelelo ya maikutlo, fa batho ba ba lebang mogare o jaaka matlhabisa ditlhong le bona ba dira dilo boima le go feta.

en: Discussion on the mental health impact of COVID-19:
tsn: Puisano ka ga matsela a COVID-19 mo boitekanelong jwa tlhaloganyo:

en: While some are only talking about it, others have experienced it and the psychological impact is massive.
tsn: Fa ba bangwe ba bua fela ka ga yona, ba bangwe ba itemogetse yona mme  seabe se se nang le yona mo tlhaloganyong ya motho ke se segolo thata.

en: COVID-19 survivor Gadifele Lofu recounts her ordeal.
tsn: Mofalodi wa COVID-19, Gadifele Lofu o gakologwelwa botlhoko jo a bo utlwileng.

en: My name is Gadifele Rejoice Lofu.
tsn: Leina la me ke Gadifele Rejoice Lofu.

en: I stay in Ventersdorp, in Tshing extension 4.
tsn: Ke nna mo Ventersdorp, mo Tshing, Extension 4.

en: I have two children
tsn: Ke na le bana ba le babedi.

en: I started falling ill on 12 December 2020 while at work.
tsn: Ke simolotse go lwala ka di 12 tsa Sedimonthole ka 2020, fa ke ne ke le kwa tirong.

en: On the 14th of December, I was admitted to ICU.
tsn: Ka di 14 tsa Sedimonthole, ke ne ka amogelwa kwa ICU.

en: It was not nice because I didn’t understand anything; I was in pain and my situation was deteriorating.
tsn: Go ne go se monate ka ntlha ya gore ke ne ke sa tlhaloganye sepe. Ke ne ke le mo botlhokong mme maemo a me a ne a etegela.

en: My family could not visit me in hospital.
tsn: Ba lelapa la me ba ne ba sa kgone go nketela kwa bookelong.

en: Its more painful that I lost some family members while in ICU.
tsn: Go botlhoko thata gore ke latlhegetswe ke bangwe ba losika fa ke ne ke le kwa ICU.

en: Another survivor Tshediso Mashoaliba says the journey has been quite traumatic.
tsn: Mofalodi yo mongwe, Tshediso Mashoaliba  a re loeto lo e nnile le le tshosang.

en: My name is Tshediso Moshoaliba.
tsn: Leina la me ke Tshediso Moshoaliba.

en: I’m 33 years of age
tsn: Ke na le dingwaga di le 33

en: Originally, I’m from Welkom in the Free State, but currently residing in Ventersdorp.
tsn: Ke tlhaga kwa Welkom kwa Foreisetata, mme ga jaana ke nna mo Ventersdorp .

en: The journey is quite traumatic.
tsn: Loeto le, le tshosa e le tota.

en: I can’t recall how I was placed on a ventilator.
tsn: Ga ke kgone go gopola gore ke tsentswe jang mo motšhineng wa go thusa go hema.

en: At one stage, I thought I was in Welkom, at one stage, I thought I was in Klerksdorp.
tsn: Nako nngwe, ke ne ke akanya gore ke ne ke le mo Welkom, ka nako e le nngwe, ke ne ke akanya gore ke kwa Klerksdorp.

en: The pain was quite severe, I could not even swallow properly.
tsn: Botlhoko jwa teng bo ne bo gateletse thata, ke ne ke sa kgone le go metsa sentle.

en: So, the psychological impact is quite unbearable.
tsn: Ka jalo, tsela e bo amang tlhaloganyo ka yona ke e o ka se kgoneng go e itshokela.

en: Even during my journey, currently, I experience depression, anxiety and the stigma that is also attached.
tsn: Tota le mo nakong ya leeto la me, ga jaana, ke ikutlwa ke na le  kgatelelo ya maikutlo, le tsela e batho ba bo lebang ekare ke matlhabisa ditlhong.

en: Affected frontline workers: Frontline staffers are not exempted.
tsn: Badiri ba ba dirang kwa pele ba ba amegileng: Badiri ba ba dirang kwa pele ga ba a bolokesega.

en: Many get infected, the risks that come with the job.
tsn: Ba le bantsi ba a tshwaetsega, dikotsi tse di tlang le tiro.

en: Mediclinic Specialist and Physician, Dr Thabo Pilane, says the isolation period came with a lot of stress.
tsn: Ngaka e e kgethegileng ya kwa Mediclinic, Ngaka Thabo Pilane, a re nako ya go itlhaola e tlile le kgatelelo e ntsi thata ya maikutlo.

en: I have contracted COVID-19,  and had to isolate for ten days at home.
tsn: Ke tshwaeditswe ke COVID-19, mme ke ne ka tshwanelwa ke go itlhaola le go nna malatsi a le lesome kwa gae.

en: During the isolation period, I had a lot of thoughts, stress, mental challenges, psychological stress about the diseases; worrying about whether one will make it.
tsn: Ka nako e ya go itlhaola, ke nnile le dikakanyo tse dintsi thata, kgatelelo ya maikutlo, kgatelelo ya tlhaloganyo ka ga malwetse, matshenyego a gore a ke tla falola kgotsa nnyaa.

en: The ten days feel like the whole year; every day is quite long.
tsn: Malatsi a le lesome a utlwala e kete ke ngwaga otlhe; letsatsi le lengwe le le lengwe le letelele.

en: I, for one, had my family members infected.
tsn: Nna ka bo nna, ke tshwaeditse  maloko a lelapa la me.

en: So, I infected my wife and kids at home.
tsn: Ka jalo, ke tshwaeditse mosadi wa me le bana kwa gae.

en: Well, by the grace of God, they all survived.
tsn: Le gale, ka tshegofatso ya Modimo, botlhe ba falotse.

en: We recovered all at home.
tsn: Rotlhe re falotse kwa gae.

en: Another Mediclinic Specialist Physician, Dr Sifiso Masuku, says looking after COVID-19 patients has been difficult.
tsn: Moalafi yo mongwe yo o kgethegileng wa kwa Mediclinic Ngaka sifiso masuku, a re go tlhokomela balwetse ba COVID-19 go ntse go le thata.

en: The impact of having to look after COVID-19 positive patients, very difficult experience for all of us; for myself and my colleagues.
tsn: Kamego ya go tshwanelwa ke go tlhokomela balwetse ba ba tshwaeditsweng ke COVID-19, e nnile maitemogelo a a boima thata mo go rona botlhe; mo go nna le badirammogo ka nna.

en: Unfortunately, it’s having a negative impact, not only on our resolve to become doctors, and wanting to do best for our patients.
tsn: Ka bomadimabe, e nna le khuetso e e sa siamang, e seng fela mo maikaelelong a rona a go nna  dingaka, le go batla thusa balwetse ba rona ka bojotlhe jwa rona.

en: Unfortunately, as a father, I question my decisions.
tsn: Ka maswabi, jaaka rre, ke ipotsa dipotsa ka ga tshwetso e ke e tsereng.

en: I question myself as a human being.
tsn: Ke ipotsa dipotso jaaka ke le motho.

en: I question myself for the choice of profession that I chose because I put my life at risk every single day.
tsn: Ke ipotsa dipotso ka ga tlhopho ya porofešene e ke tlhophile ka gonne ke tsenya botshelo jwa me mo kotsing letsatsi le letsatsi.

en: It is at a time like this that psychological support is of paramount importance.
tsn: Ke ka nako e tshwana le e mo tshegetso ya tlhalogalonya e leng botlhokwa thata.

en: Clinical Psychologist Dr Sammy Thekiso: while COVID-19 is an individual-specific condition, it arouses a collective response.
tsn: Ngaka ya tsa tlhaloganyo, Ngaka Sammy Thekiso: le fa COVID-19 e le bolwetse jwa motho ka boena, e batla tsibogelo e e kopanetsweng.

en: My personal experience is that since the advance of coronavirus and COVID-19, it has been that, much as coronavirus is an individual specific condition, it, however, also arouses the collective response whereby you find that an individual presents with symptoms such as your anxiety, your panic attack, and your depression.
tsn: Maitemogelo a me ke gore, fa e sale coronavirus le COVID-19 di ntse di gola, e nnile gore, jaaka  fa coronavirus e le bolwetse jwa motho yo o rileng, e batla tsibogo e e kopanetsweng, mo o fitlhelang e le gore motho o na le matshwao a a tshwanang le kgatelelo ya tlhaloganyo, letshogo le kgatelelo ya maikutlo.

en: However, you will realise that the situation affects not only an individual but the whole systems surrounding an individual as the family, as other important sectors of the society, like your work, like your institutions such as school.
tsn: Le fa go le jalo, o tla lemoga gore maemo a, ga a ame motho a le mongwe fela mme a ama le dilo tse di go dikaganyeditseng jaaka ba lelapa, le ditheo tse dingwe tsa botlhokwa tsa setšhaba, jaaka tiro ya gago, jaaka ditheo tsa gago jaaka sekolo.

en: Lofu is still receiving treatment while Moshoaliba is undergoing counselling.
tsn: Lofu o santse a amogela kalafi, fa Moshoaliba ena a amogela thuso ya tsa maikutlo

en: Understanding the impact of COVID-19 trauma: The City of Johannesburg has encouraged residents to take part 8h30 and 9h30 this evening by switching off the lights for that one hour.
tsn: Go tlhaloganya seabe sa letshogo le le tliswang ke  COVID-19: Toropo ya Johannesburg e rotloeditse baagi go tsaya karolo ka 8h30 le 09h30 mo maitseboeng ano ke go tima dipone mo ureng eo.

en: This year’s theme is Climate Change to save Earth.
tsn: Setlhogo sa ngwaga o, ke phetogo ya tlelaemete le go boloka lefatshe.

en: The event is a global initiative by the World Wide Fund for Nature to help raise awareness of the need to protect the planet.
tsn: Tiragalo eno ke kgato ya lefatshe ka bophara ya lefatshe ya World Wide Fund for Nature, go thusa go godisa temoso ya tlhokego ya go sireletsa polanete.

en: The symbolic gesture of turning off the lights is targeted at raising awareness about climate change and the effect it has on the planet.
tsn: Letshwao la kaelo la go tima dipone le lebisitswe mo go godisiseng temoso ka ga phetogo ya tlelaemete le tshusumetso e le nang le yona mo polaneteng.

en: The world’s major economies, including China, the US and Europe are rapidly moving away from fossil fuels toward renewable energy sources including wind and solar.
tsn: Diikonomi tse dikgolo tsa lefatshe, go akaretsa China, US le Europe, di katoga ka lobelo le le kwa godimo dituki tsa fosili go lebelela metswedi ya maatla a a ntšhwafadiwang go akaretsa phefo le letsatsi.

en: South Africa is also introducing more wind and solar power sources.
tsn: Aforikaborwa le yona e simolola go tlhagisa metswedi e mengwe ya phefo le motlakase o o dirisang mogote wa letsatsi.

en: Deputy Director of Communications in the office of the MMC for Environment and Infrastructure, Stanley Itshegetseng, says, We are creating awareness about emissions that are affecting the environment about which products are affecting land field.
tsn: Motlatsa Mokaedi wa tsa tlhaeletsano ka mo Ofising ya MMC wa tsa tikologo le mafaratlhatlha, Stanley Itshegetseng, a re, re ya go tlhola temoso ka ga digase tse di amang tikologo tse didiriswa tsa tsona di amang lefatshe.

en: We are an industrialised city.
tsn: Re toropo e e nang le tselopele.

en: There is a lot of factories here and how do we create green factories that has lower emissions?
tsn: Go na le madirelo a le mantsi fa, mme re tlhama jang tshomarelo ya madirelo e e nang le kwelo e e tlase ya gase?

en: Dr Sandy-Lynne Steenhuizen says artificial light at night is any light in the house, business, or town that could be affecting pollinators, insects, and animals that are active at night in gardens and nature around us.
tsn: Ngaka Sandy-Lynne Steenhuizen a re, lesedi la maitirelo la bosigo, ke lesedi lengwe le lengwe le le bonagalang mo ntlong, kwa dikgwebo kgotsa kwa toropong, le le ka tswang le ama mmudula, ditshenekegi, le diphologolo tse di tlhaga mo bosigong mo ditshingwaneng le tlhago e e re dikologileng.

en: She adds that artificial light at night is a driver for the decline in pollinators.
tsn: O ne a oketsa ka gore lesedi la maitirelo la bosigo ke mokgweetsi go wela kwa tlase ga mmudula.

en: The City of Cape Town has called on residents to join the national switch off all non-essential lights for an hour  between 8H30 and 9H30 this evening to mark Earth Hour.
tsn: Toropo ya Kapa e kopile baagi go nna karolo ya Bosetšhaba ya go tima dipone tsotlhe tse di sa tlhokegeng, ura e le nngwe fa gare ga 8h30 le 9h30 maitseboeng ano go tshwaya ura ya lefatshe lotlhe.

en: Cape Town Mayor, Dan Plato, says they’re also launching an initiative to encourage residents to take action against climate change.
tsn: Rratoropo wa Cape Town, Dan Plato, a re gape ba thankgolola letsholo la go rotloetsa baagi go tsaya kgato kgatlhanong le phetogo ya tlelaemete.

en: The Let’s Act campaign is aimed at changing responses to the issue.
tsn: Letsholo la “Let’s Act” le ikaeletse go fetola ditsibogo ya ntlha e.

en: Meanwhile, A group of eco-warriors is dedicating part of their weekend to cleaning up the Durban Harbour in commemoration of Earth Hour.
tsn: Re sa ntse re le foo, setlhopha sa balweladiphetogo ba tsa tikologo ba dirisa nako ya bona ya mafelo a beke go phepafatsa boemelakepe jwa kwa Durban, jaaka segopotso sa ya ura ya lefatshe lotlhe.

en: University of KwaZulu-Natal student Doctor Refilwe Mofokeng is driving the clean-up that will focus on picking up plastic waste in and around the harbour precinct.
tsn: Moithuti wa Yunibesiti ya KwaZulu-Natal, Ngaka Refilwe Mofokeng ke ena a  kgweetsang letsholo le la go phepafatsa, le le tla tlhomang mogopolo mo go seleng dipolasetiki tse di kgotlhelang mo teng ga, le mo tikologong ya boemelakepe.

en: South Africans are being urged to look after their environment and recycle plastic waste especially single-use plastics like cold drink bottles.
tsn: Maaforikaborwa a a rotloediwa go tlhokomela tikologo ya bona le go tlosa dipolasetiki tse di kgotlhelang mme di dirisiwe sešwa, segolobogolo dipolasetiki tse di dirisiwang gangwe fela jaaka dibotlolo tsa dinotsididi.

en: Additional reporting by Minoshni Pillay.
tsn: Pego e e tlaleletsang ka Minoshni Pillay.

en: Marcelo Toledo usually creates sculptures and jewellery out of metal.
tsn: Marcelo Toledo go le gale o dira ditshwantsho tse di takilweng le dibenya ka go dirisa tshipi.

en: Now the Argentine artist is working with a new material: waste masks and syringes from the COVID-19 pandemic to create an exhibition exploring the painful impact of the virus.
tsn: Jaanong motaki yo wa kwa Argentina, o dira ka dilo tse dintšhwa: Matlakala a dimaseke le mamao a a neng a dirisetswa leroborobo la COVID-19 go dira pontsho ya go sekaseka seabe se se botlhoko se mogare o nnileng le sona.

en: Toledo, who has made jewellery for the musical Evita on Broadway and unique pieces for Barack Obama and Madonna, was among the first in Argentina to contract COVID-19 a year ago, which left him hospitalised for eight days with pneumonia.
tsn: Toledo, yo o dirileng dibenya tsa mmino wa Evita kwa Broadway le tse dingwe tse di kgethegileng tse a di diretseng Barack Obama le Madonna, e ne e le mongwe wa batho ba ntlha kwa Argentina go tsenwa ke mogare wa COVID-19 mo ngwageng o o fetileng, e e robaditseng kwa bookelong ka ntlha ya pneumonia.

en: The experience left an imprint on his life and triggered a flurry of artworks, from a 14-meter mask with the Argentine flag that he placed on the iconic Obelisk in Buenos Aires to raise awareness about organ donation during the pandemic.
tsn: Maitemogelo a, a tlogetse letshwao mo botshelong jwa gagwe mme a mo fa le maatla a go  dira ditshwantsho tsa botaki, go tloga ka maseke wa dimetara di le  14 o o nang le folaga ya kwa Argentina o a neng a beile kwa Obelisk kwa Buenos Aires go dira temoso ka ga go abelana ka dithwe ka mmele ka nako ya leroborobo

en: For his new exhibition, the Museum of the After, Toledo is collecting recycled coronavirus waste sent by hospitals, laboratories and random people.
tsn: Kwa pontshong ya gagwe, “The Museum of the After”, Toledo o kokoanya matlakala a didiriswa tsa Corona Virus a a rometsweng ke maokelo, dilaboratoriamo le batho fela.

en: It includes old vaccines and medical parts, and newspaper clippings about the pandemic.
tsn: A akaretsa meento ya kgale le dikarolo tsa kalafi, le dikgang tsa mo kuranteng ka ga leroborobo.

en: I am excited to be able to transform pain into beauty and this exhibition is just that, capturing everything that is happening to us as a society, Toledo, 45, told Reuters in his workshop in the San Telmo district of Buenos Aires.
tsn: Ke itumeletse go kgona go fetola botlhoko go nna bontle mme pontsho e, ke sona tota seo, e bontsha sengwe le sengwe se se diragalang mo go rona jaaka setšhaba, Toledo, 45, o boleletse  Reuters kwa tirong ya gagwe ya go tlhabana botlhale kwa San Telmo, kwa kgaolong ya Buenos Aires.

en: The artworks, which will go on show from September in a public space in downtown Buenos Aires, will all be made from disposable materials or garbage that people send me, many of them sealed inside vacuum-packed bags.
tsn: Ditshwantsho tsa botaki, tse di tlaa tlhagisiwang go tloga ka Lwetse kwa lefelong la botlhe kwa toropong ya Buenos Aires, tsotlhe di tlaa be di dirilwe ka didiriswa tse di latlhilweng kgotsa matlakala a ke a romelelwang ke batho, bontsi jwa ona bo tsentswe mo ka fa gare ga dikgetsi tse di tswetsweng.

en: It is the first time that I do an exhibition in which I do not have to buy any of the elements, he said.
tsn: Ke la ntlha ke dira pontsho e mo go  yona ke ne ke sa tlhoke go reka dikarolo dipe. A bua jalo.

en: It will all be enclosed or put in capsules because we should never forget this.
tsn: E tlaa be e tswaletswe kgotsa e tsentswe ka mo gare ga sejana gonne ga re a tshwanela go e lebala.

en: So the idea is that everything can be preserved over time.
tsn: Ka jalo, kakanyo ke gore, dilo tsotlhe di ka bolokiwa mo tsamaong ya nako.

en: In the exhibition, there will be a real ship that symbolically crosses a storm and recycling islands to raise awareness about the importance of caring for the environment.
tsn: Mo pontshong e, go tlaa nna le sekepe sa nnete se se tlaa  kgabaganyang dinokana le go  dirasešwa ga ditlhaketlhake go dira temoso ka ga botlhokwa jwa go tlhokomela tikologo.

en: The exhibition will tell the story of this ship that went sailing and was stranded after the storm, which is a great metaphor for what is happening to us.
tsn: Pontsho e, e tlaa tlotla kgang ka ga sekepe se se neng se tsamaya mo metsing, mme sa sala se iphotlhere morago ga matlakadibe. Se ke tshwantshiso e ntle ya se se re diragalelang.

en: This pandemic, its a great global storm, Toledo said.
tsn: Leroborobo leno, ke matlakadibe a magolo mo lefatsheng, Toledo o buile jalo.

en: As with the giant mask, which was replicated in countries such as the United States and Japan, the artist dreams of reproducing the new exhibition in other cities around the world.
tsn: Jaaka ka maseke o mogolo o, o o neng wa dirwa gape kwa dinageng  tse di jaaka United States le Japan, motaki yo, o na le ditoro tsa go ntsifatsa pontsho e ntšhwa mo ditoropong tse dingwe mo lefatsheng lotlhe.

en: The idea of this Museum of the After is, on one hand, to look for elements from all over the world, and also to be able to replicate it in other places and even get a physical museum to leave the work for posterity, he said.
tsn: Kgopolo ya gagwe ya “The Museum of the After”, ka fa letlhakoreng le lengwe, ke go tlhokomela dikarolo go tswa mo lefatsheng ka bophara, mme gape le go kgona go e dira gape mo mafelong a mangwe, le go bona musiamo wa nnete o kwa go ona go ka tlogelwang tiro e gore e somarelelwe dikokomane tsa isago, a rialo.

en: French households feasted on cheese last year as they turned to home cooking and sought gastronomic comfort during coronavirus lockdowns that shuttered the restaurant trade.
tsn: Malapa a kwa Fora ne a ijesa monate ja go ja kase mo ngwageng o o fetileng, fa ba ne ba simolola go apaya kwa gae mme ba batla dijo tse ba ka ikgomotsang ka tsona ka nako ya kiletsometsao ka ntlha ya mogare wa corona o o digileng dikgwebo tsa diresetšhuranta

en: The amount of cheese purchased by French shoppers for at-home consumption increased by more than 8% in 2020, compared with just 2% the previous year, according to figures from farming agency FranceAgriMer and market data firm Kantar.
tsn: Tlhotlhwa ya theko ya kase e e neng e rekiwa ke bareki ba Mafora gore ba kgone go e dirisa kwa gae, e oketsegile ka diperesente di feta 8 ka 2020, fa go bapisiwa le diperesente di le 2 fela tsa mo ngwageng o o fetileng, go ya ka dipalopalo go tswa go Setheo sa temothuo, Franceagrimer le setlamo sa tshedimosetso e e tsetsepetseng, Kantar.

en: That was part of a shift in food consumption in many countries last year as the COVID-19 pandemic unfolded, with households initially bulk buying staples like pasta and flour, and later settling into home-eating habits with extra purchases of products like butter.
tsn: Seo e ne e le karolo ya tshuto ya theko ya dijo mo dinageng di le dintsi mo ngwageng o o fetileng fa leroborobo la COVID-19 le ne ne le simolola, le fa malapa a mantsi a ne a rekela dilo bontsing jaaka pasta le folouru, mme moragonyana ba tlwaela mekgwa ya go ja kwa gae, le go reka dilo tse di jaaka botoro.

en: In France, mozzarella saw the steepest rise in demand among major cheese categories, with a 21% volume jump, followed by a 12% increase for raclette  a winter favourite eaten melted with potatoes and cured meats.
tsn: Kwa France, mozzarella e itemogetse tlhatlogo e e kwa godimo thata magareng ga mefuta e mengwe ya kase, ka koketsego ya 21%, e latelwa ke 12% ya Raclette e e jewang thata ka nako ya mariga, e nyerolotswe ka ditapole le nama.

en: Along with strong supermarket sales of ingredient cheeses for cooking, specialist shops like Augustin Denous in Boulogne-Billancourt just outside Paris have reported more trade from locked-down households looking for a culinary treat.
tsn: Mmogo le dithekiso tse di kwa godimo tsa metswako ya kase tse di dirisetswang go apaya, mabenkele a baitseanape a a jaaka Augustin Denous kwa Boulogne-Billancourt, ka fa ntle fela ga Paris, a begile theko e e kwa godimo go tswa go malapa a a leng ka fa tlase ga kiletsometsao, a a batlang dijo tsa manobonobo.

en: In our little way, we’ve helped prevent people going completely gloomy.
tsn: Ka tselanyana ya rona e nnye, re kgonne go thusa gore batho ba seke ba tlhoafala thata.

en: There’s been a moment of pleasure at the dinner table with good wine, good bread and good cheese.
tsn: Go nnile le nako e e monate kwa tafoleng ya dijo tsa maitseboa, ka beine e e monate, borotho jo bo monate le kase e e monate.

en: Its one of those pleasures that are still accessible, one of Denous customers, Nicolas, said at the store.
tsn: Ke dingwe tsa dilo tse di monate tse re santseng re kgona go di fitlhelela. Mongwe wa bareki ba kwa Denous, Nicolas, o buile jalo kwa lebenkeleng.

en: Cheese has nonetheless fared better than products like champagne or fish that are more reliant on events and restaurant trade.
tsn: Le fa go le jalo, kase e dirile botoka thata go feta ditlamelo tse di jaaka šhampeine  kgotsa tlhapi tse di ikaegileng ka ditiragalo le kgwebo ya diresetšhuranta.

en: Cheese lovers also see an opportunity to safeguard Frances renowned array of artisanal cheeses.
tsn: Barati ba kase le bona, ba bona tšhono ya go sireletsa dikase tse di tumileng thata tsa kwa France.

en: There is really an enthusiasm about farming and we need to make sure that is reflected in the arrival of new, younger producers, said Veronique Richez-Lerouge, president of Frances local cheeses association and founder of an annual cheese day, taking place on Saturday.
tsn: Go tota go na le phisegelo ka ga bolemirui mme re tshwanetse go netefatsa gore e bonwa mo go gorogeng ga badiri ba bašwa, go bua Veronique, Richez-Lerouge, moporesitente wa mokgatlho wa selegae wa dikase kwa France le mosilodi wa “Cheese day” e e diragalang ngwaga le ngwaga, e e tlaa tshwarwang ka Lamatlhatso.

en: Germany has banned unnecessary surgeries on babies who are born intersex, neither clearly male or female, but critics warned on Friday that the new law could easily be sidestepped by doctors and parents.
tsn: Germany e thibetse dikaro tse di sa tlhokegeng  tsa bana ba ba belegweng ba na le bong jwa bonna le  jwa bosadi, se se raya gore ga go a tlhapa gore a ke monna kgotsa ke mosadi, mme basekaseki ba tsibositse ka Labotlhano gore Molao o mošwa o ka nna wa beelwa  kwa thoko ke dingaka le batsadi.

en: Lawmakers in the Bundestag parliament voted late on Thursday to join several European countries in banning cosmetic operations that seek to ensure the child ascribes to traditional notions of male and female.
tsn: Badiramolao kwa palamenteng ya Bundestag ba tsenetse ditlhopho ka Labone go kopana le dinaga di le mmalwa tsa kwa Europe, go  iletsa dikaro tse di dirwang  go netefatsa gore ngwana o latela ditumelo tsa setso tsa bonna le bosadi.

en: From now on, a family court will have to authorise such surgeries on children diagnosed with variations of sexual development, a medical term often used to refer to intersex people.
tsn: Go tloga jaanong, Kgotlatshekelo ke yona e tlaa tsayang tshwetso ya dikaro tseo mo baneng ba ba nang le dipharologano tsa bong, Lereo la bongaka le gantsi le dirisiwang fa buiwa ka batho ba ba nang le dithwe tsa bonna le tsa bosadi..

en: About 1.7% of babies are born intersex, according to the United Nations, with a small proportion undergoing operations to bring the appearance and function of their genitalia into line with that expected of males or females.
tsn: Palo e ka nna 1.7% ya bana ba belegwa ba na le dithwe tsa bonna le tsa bosadi go ya ka United Nations, ka palo e nnye e e dirwang dikaro go tlisa ponagalo le tiriso ya dirwe tsa bona mo seemong se se tlwaeleging sa banna kgotsa sa basadi.

en: Research suggests that unnecessary surgeries performed without childrens consent can lead to psychological damage later in life, and intersex rights campaigners broadly welcomed the ban in Germany.
tsn: Dipatlisiso di tshitshinya gore dikaro tse di sa tlhokegeng, tse di dirwang kwa ntle ga tumalano le bana, di ka baka tshenyo mo tlhaloganyong moragonyana mo botshelong, mme balweladitshwanelo tsa batho ba ba bonweng ka dirwe tsa bonna le tsa bosadi ba amogetse thibelo e kwa Germany.

en: We’re very happy that there is finally a law about this, but the ban has loopholes and leaves many questions unanswered, Charlotte Wunn, head of intersex rights group Intergeschlechtliche Menschen, told the Thomson Reuters Foundation.
tsn: Re itumetse thata gore kwa bofelong, go na le molao ka ga seno, mme fela thibelo e, e na le diphatlha mme e tlogela dipotso di le dintsi di sena dikarabo, Charlotte Wunn, tlhogo ya setlhopha sa ditshwanelo tsa batho ba ba bonweng ba na le dirwe tsa bonna le tsa bosadi, Intergeschlechtliche Menschen, o boleletse setheo sa Thomson Reuters.

en: Parents and doctors could get around the new law and proceed with surgery by avoiding an intersex diagnosis, and the legislation does not stipulate penalties, Wunn and others said.
tsn: Batsadi le dingaka ba ka kgona go ya ka Molao o mošwa, mme ba  tswela pele ka karo ka go tila tlhatlhobo ya bong, le peomolao ga e a tlhomamisa dikwatlhao, go bua Wunn le ba bangwe.

en: The room for interpretation is enormous and the ban is very easy to circumvent, said Free Democratic Party lawmaker Jens Brandenburg.
tsn: Thibelo e e ka ranolwa ka ditsela tse dintsi mme gape go bonolo go e ikgatolosa, go bua modiramolao wa Free Democratic Party, Jens Brandenburg.

en: According to a study by the University of Bochum, 1,871 children under the age of 10 underwent feminising or masculinising surgery between 2005 and 2016 in Germany, which joins Malta and Portugal in banning such procedures.
tsn: Go ya ka patlisiso ya kwa Yunibesiti ya Bochum, bana ba le 1,871, ba ba ka fa tlase ga dingwaga di le 10, ba dirilwe karo ya bong fa gare ga 2005 le 2016 kwa Germany, e mmogo le Malta le Portugal ba thibelang dikaro tsa mofuta o.

en: Spain’s parliament is currently discussing a measure similar to the German ban, which Olaf Hiort  a professor at the University Hospital in Luebeck  said he hoped would curb uncontrolled operations.
tsn: Palamente ya kwa Spain e tshwaragane le dipuisano ka ntlha  e e tshwanang le e ya kwa Germany, e Olaf Hiort, Moporofesara kwa Yunibesiting ya kwa bookelong jwa Luebeck o rileng o solofela fa di ka fedisa dikaro tseo.

en: He noted, however, that while there was now a ban, there is no penalty.
tsn: O tlhagisitse gore le fa go na le thibelo, ga go na kotlo.

en: Its been a year since South Africa went into lockdown.
tsn: E setse e le ngwaga fa e sale Aforikaborwa e tsena ka fa tlase ga molao wa kiletsometsamao.

en: Many things have happened since then, but its not been all doom and gloom as some welcomed their precious gifts on the day.
tsn: Dilo di le dintsi di diragetse go tloga ka nako eo, fela ga e se tsotlhe tse di hutsang le tse di tlisang boitlhobogo jaaka ba bangwe ba ne ba amogela dimpho tse di botlhokwa tsa letsatsi.

en: Leane Chirwa gave birth to a baby boy Jordan on the day.
tsn: Leane. Chirwa o belege ngwana wa mosimane, Jordan ka letsatsi leo.

en: She says she never imagined how the world would turn out after the birth of her child.
tsn: A re ga a ka a nagana gore lefatshe le tla tswelela pele jang morago ga botsalo jwa ngwana wa gagwe.

en: Baby Jordan is one of the select children born on the day President Cyril Rampahosa announced that the country was going on lockdown to prevent the then novel coronavirus.
tsn: Lesea Jordan ke mongwe ba bana ba ba tlhophilwe, ba ba belegweng ka letsatsi le Moporesidente Cyril Rampahosa o neng a dira kitsiso ya gore naga ya rona e tlile go nna ka fa tlase ga molao wa kiletsometsamao go thibela mogare wa corona.

en: His mom, the 38-year-old Leane Chirwa from Cosmo City says the uncertainty and anxiety were just too much for her as she was heavily pregnant.
tsn: Mme wa gagwe wa dingwaga di le 38, Leane Chirwa yo o tswang kwa Cosmo City a re dipelaelo le tlhobaelo di ne di le dintsi thata mo go ena ka ntlha ya fa a ne a imile mme a le gaufi le go belega ka nako eo.

en: Twelve months later, she’s a proud mom, raising a healthy baby boy, fondly known as Jojo.
tsn: Morago ga dikgwedi tse somepedi, ke mme yo o motlotlo, yo o godisang ngwana wa mosimane yo o itekanetseng yo o itsegeng jaaka Jojo.

en: She credits the professionalism of health workers for overcoming her fear.
tsn: O akgola badiri ba seporofešenale ba tsa pholo ka go mo thusa go fenya letshogo.

en: Chirwa says despite the tough experience, she’s glad her boy brings a smile to the family.
tsn: Chirwa a re, kwa ntle ga maitemogelo a a boima, o itumetse thata gonne mosimane wa gagwe o go tlisa monyebo mo lelapeng.

en: She only returned to work at the end of January 2021.
tsn: O boetse tirong fela kwa bokhutlong jwa kgwedi ya Ferikgong 2021.

en: While the future remains uncertain under the new normal, she’s hoping, the virus will soon disappear.
tsn: Le fa go na le ketsaetsego ka botshelo jo bo sa tlwaelegang jo, o solofela gore mogare o o tla nyelela mo nakong e e sa fediseng pelo.

en: While Chirwa and the world talk about the new normal, for baby Jordan, this is the only life he knows.
tsn: Fa Chirwa le lefatshe lotlhe ba bua ka botshelo jo bo sa tlwaelegang, mo go lesea, Jordan, jo, ke jona fela botshelo jo a bo itseng.

en: As we seek to return to our normal way of life, for Jojo, it will be a whole new normal as he has never known anything other than this.
tsn: Jaaka rona re batla go boela kwa botshelong jo re bo tlwaetseng, mo go Jojo e tlaa be e le sengwe se se sa tlwaelegang ka ntlha ya fa a sa itse sepe kwa ntle ga se.

en: One year since South Africa went into lockdown.
tsn: Ngwaga o le mongwe fa e sale Afrorika e tsena ka fa tlase ga molao wa kiletsometsamao.

en: Midnight March 26 marks one year since South Africa went under lockdown.
tsn: Bosigogare jwa di 26 tsa Mopitlwe e tla be e le ngwanga o le mongwe fa e sale Aforikaborwa e le ka fa tlase ga molao wa kiletsometsamao.

en: SABC News looks back at some COVID-19-related stories that left South Africans shocked and outraged since President Cyril Ramaphosa first announced what was supposed to be a 21-day lockdown on 23 March 2020.
tsn: Ba dikgang tsa SABC ba lebelela kwa morago go leba dikgang tsa COVID-19 tse di tlogetseng Maaforikaborwa a tshogile e bile a tenegile go tloga ka motsi o Moporesidente Cyril Ramaphosa o neng a dira kitsiso ya ntlha e e  neng e tshwanetse go nna matsatsi a le 21 fela a kiletsometsamao ka 23 Mopitlwe 2020.

en: It all started when the first case of COVID-19 in South African was detected in KwaZulu-Natal.
tsn: Tsotlhe di simolotse fa kgetse ya ntlha ya COVID-19 mo Aforikaborwa e ne e lemogwa kwa KwaZulu-Natal.

en: A 38-year-old man who had travelled to Italy on holiday with a group of 10 people tested positive for the virus.
tsn: Monna wa dingwaga yo o neng a etetse kwa Italy ka malatsing a boikhutso le setlhopha sa batho ba le 10, ba dirile diteko mme tsa kaya fa ba na le mogare.

en: Since then over 1.5 million South Africans have contracted the virus and there have been more than 50 000 COVID 19-related deaths.
tsn: Fa e sale ka nako eo, Maaforikaborwa a feta dimilione di le 1.5 ba tshwaeditswe ke mogare mme go na le dintsho di le 50 000 tse di tlhomamisitsweng.

en: Below are some of the regulations that sent tongues wagging and shocking incidents.
tsn: Fa tlase ke mengwe ya melawana e e galefisitseng batho le ditiragalo tse di gakgamatsang.

en: Ban on alcohol and cigarettes sales
tsn: Thibelo ya dithekiso tsa nnotagi le disekerete.

en: In what was described as one of the worlds strictest lockdowns, South Africa banned the sale of alcohol and tobacco products, saying it would compromise the health of citizens.
tsn: Mo go se se neng se tlhalosiwa jaaka nngwe ya melawana ya kiletsometsao e e gagametseng thata, Aforikaborwa e ne ya thibela thekiso ya nnotagi le dikumo tsa motsoko, e re di tlaa tsenya boitekanelo jwa baagi mo kotsing.

en: Citizens faced a five-month ban on the sale of cigarettes and three alcohol bans since the pandemic hit last March, the last was imposed on 28 December.
tsn: Baagi ba ne ba lebana le thibelo ya thekiso ya disekerete ya dikgwedi di le tlhano, le dithibelo di le tharo tsa thekiso ya nnotagi go tloga ka tshimologo ya leroborobo ka kgwedi ya Mopitlwe, ya bofelo e tswentswe tirisong ka di 28 Sedimonthole.

en: This sparked public outrage and resulted in the black market thriving with sales going up to more than double its market value.
tsn: Se se tsositse kgalefo mo bathong mme  dithekiso tse di seng ka fa molaong di tsa simolola go dira madi a mantsi, ba ne ba bona dipoelo tse fetang tsa kwa marekelong gabedi.

en: It, therefore, comes as no surprise that other top searches in South Africa for 2020 included searches such as how to make pineapple beer.
tsn: Ka jalo, ga  go makatse gore dipatlisiso tse dingwe tse di kwa godimo mo Aforikaborwa ka 2020 di akaretsa dipatlisisio tse di tshwanang le go dira bojalwa ka peinapole.

en: However, this proved fatal for some who died after the consumption of homemade alcohol or were rushed to hospital for poisoning.
tsn: Le gale, seno se itshupile se le kotsi mo go ba bangwe ba tlhokafetseng morago ga go nwa bojalwa jo bo itiretsweng kwa gae kgotsa ba ne ba itlhaganedisetswa kwa bookelong ka ntlha ya tšhefi.

en: I now have a criminal record for being caught with 1 cigarette, but ANC get away with 500 billion, so can ANC arrest ANC?
tsn: Jaanong ke na le rekoto ya bosenyi ya go tshwarwa ka sekerete se le sengwe, fela ANC yona e kgonne go falola ka dibione di le 500, ka jalo a ANC e ka tshwara ANC?

en: During the hard lockdown, mothers were left frustrated after they couldn’t buy to buy clothes for their babies because of the nationwide lockdown.
tsn: Ka nako ya kiletsometsamao e e gagametseng, bomme ba iphitlhetse ba tsielegile morago ga gore ba palelwe ke go rekela bana ba bona diaparo ka ntlha ya kiletsometsao naga ka bophara.

en: Shops were open only for food and medication.
tsn: Mabenkele a ne a buletswe theko ya dijo le melemo fela.

en: The Tebeila Institute of Leadership, the African Institute for Human Rights and Constitutional Litigation filed an urgent application at the Constitutional Court, challenging the closure of shops that sell goods for babies.
tsn: Setheo sa Boeteledipele sa Tebeila, setheo sa ditshwanelo tsa botho sa Aforika le Molaotheo ba di be tsa tsenya kopo e e potlakileng kwa kgotlatshekelo ya Molaotheo, go bontsha fa di le kgatlhanong le go tswalwa ga mabenkele a a rekisang dithoto tsa bana.

en: After President Ramaphosa extended the nationwide lockdown by further two weeks, government amended the lockdown regulations to allow clothing shops to sell baby clothes and some necessities.
tsn: Morago ga gore moporesidente Ramaphosa a atolose melawana ya kiletsometsamao ka dibeke di le pedi, puso e ne ya tlhabolola melawana ya kiletsometsamao go letla diaparo mo mabenkeleng a a go rekisa diaparo tsa lesea le ditlhokwa tse dingwe.

en: Another bizarre COVID-19 regulation was that South African stores could only sell closed toe, shoes and short-sleeved shirts if they were promoted or displayed to be worn under jackets or jerseys.
tsn: Molao o mongwe wa COVID-19 o o neng o sa tlwaelesegang e ne e le gore mabenkele a Aforikaborwa a letleletswe go rekisa fela ditlhako tse di tswalegileng kwa pele le dihempe tsa matsogo a makhutshwane fa di etleediwa  kgotsa di aparwa ka ga tlase ga dibaki kgotsa dijeresi.

en: Soo Im on a ban from buying anymore baby clothes.
tsn: Ka jalo, ke thibetswe go reka diaparo tse dingwe tsa masea.

en: Thank God for online shopping
tsn: Re leboga Modimo gonne re kgona go reka ka kgolagano ya mafaratlhatlha.

en: After being deported by President Ramaphosa to enforce compliance to the national lockdown, alleged brutality by some SANDF and SAPS members was reported.
tsn: Morago ga go romelwa ke Moporesidente Ramaphosa go pateletsa kobamelo ya melao ya kiletsometsamao ya bosetšhaba, go begilwe setlhogo se se dirilweng ke mangwe a maloko a SAPS le SANDF.

en: Collins Khosa, a 40-year-old man from Alexandra township, north of Johannesburg, died after he was allegedly assaulted by soldiers.
tsn: Collins Khosa, monna wa dingwaga di le 40 go tswa kwa motsesetoropong wa Alexandra, kwa Bokone jwa Johannesburg, tlhokafetseng morago ga dipego tsa gore o iteilwe ke masole.

en: Social media posts also showed SANDF members forcing members of the public to perform physical exercises, beating some citizens up and confiscating their groceries.
tsn: Bobegakgang jwa loago le jona bo bontshitse maloko a SANDF a pateletsa ditokololo tsa setšhaba go ikatisa, ba betsa bangwe ba baagi ba bangwe ba le go ba tseela dikorosari  tsabona.

en: This caused a public outcry
tsn: Se sebakile dilelo mo setšhabeng.

en: The public was urged to report cases of brutality to the Independent Police Investigative Directorate (IPID).
tsn: Baagi ba ne ba rotloediwa go bega dikgetse tsa bosetlhogo go babatlisisi ba tsa sepodise ba ba ikemetseng (IPID).

en: #AskCele# Why are you Behaving like you’re the President of the Country?
tsn: #BotsaCele# Goreng o itshwere jaaka e kete o moporesitente wa naga?

en: In July 2020, allegations of Personal Protective Equipment (PPE) tender corruption amounting to millions of rand emerged from several parts of the country.
tsn: Ka kgwedi ya Phukwi 2020 ditatofatso tsa bobodu jwa thendara ya ditlamelo tsa sebele tsa Tshireletso (PPE) ya dimilione tsa diranta di ne tsa tlhagelela go tswa mo dikarolong tse di farologaneng tsa naga.

en: Presidential spokesperson Khusela Diko, Gauteng Health MEC Dr Bandile Masuku, and his wife Loyiso, went on leave of absence amid alleged irregularities relating to a R125 million PPE tender.
tsn: Mmueledi wa boporesidente Khusela Diko, MEC wa Gauteng wa tsa boitekanelo Ngaka Bandile Masuku le mosadi wa gagwe Loyiso, ba ile ba tsaya matsatsi a boikhutso fa go simolola ditatofatso tsa go tlhoka boikanyego tse di amanang le thendara ya dimilione di le R125 ya PPE.

en: The tender was awarded to Royal Bhaca Projects a company owned by Diko’s husband, who is now late.
tsn: Thendara e ne e abetswe Royal Bhaca Projects, setlamo se se tshwereng ke monna wa ga Diko yo ga jaana a tlhokafetseng.

en: In April 2020, the government distributed food parcels to the needy who were hard hit by the impact of the lockdown.
tsn: Ka Moranang 2020, puso e abelane ka diphuthelwana tsa dijo go batlhoki ba ba neng ba amilwe thata ke melao ya kiletsometsamao.

en: This was also marred by corruption claims with some councillors allegedly stashing away the groceries for themselves and their family members or unfairly distributing them to their political party members.
tsn: Seno se ne sa senngwa ke ditatofatso tsa bobodu fa makhanselara mangwe a ne a latofadiwa ka go fitlha dikorosari gore di dirisiwe ke bona le ba malapa a bona, kgotsa ba di abela maloko a lekoko la bona la sepolotiki.

en: Some were sold to foreign-owned shops.
tsn: Tse dingwe di ne tsa rekisetswa mabenkele a a tshwerweng ke batswantle.

en: In Tshwane, the South African National Civic Organisation (Sanco) opened a corruption case against some officials for allegedly distributing food parcels based on preference.
tsn: Kwa Tshwane, mokgatlho wa Aforikaborwa wa bosetšhaba wa baagi (SANCO ) o butse kgetse ya bobodu kgatlhanong le batlhankedi ba bangwe, ya go abelana ka diphuthelwana go ya ka gore mang o rata mang.

en: We will deal with the individuals concerned harshly. Cyril Ramaphosa.
tsn: Re tla mekamekana le batho ba ba amegang ka tsela e e makgwakgwa. Cyril Ramaphosa.

en: On PPE corruption (03 August 2020):
tsn: Kaga bobodu jwa PPE (03 Phatwe 2020).

en: Perpetrators are going to be dealt with decisively and harshly.
tsn: Re tla mekamekana le batho ba ba amegang ka tsela e e makgwakgwa.

en: EFF Condemns COVID-19 Food Parcel Corruption by ANC.
tsn: EFF e Kgalema bobodu jwa diphelwana tsa dijo tsa COVID-19 jo bo dirwang ke ANC.

en: Many South Africans expressed shock at the rise of gender-based violence during the lockdown.
tsn: Bontsi ba Maaforikaborwa bo bontshitse letshogo ka tlhatlogo e e kwa godimo ya tirisodikgoka e e ikaegileng ka bong ka nako ya kiletsometsao.

en: Masimanyane Women’s Support Centre said there had been a spike in rape, incest and marital rape cases.
tsn: Senthara ya tshegetso ya basadi ya Masimanyane e rile go nnile le tlhatlogo ya dikgetse tsa petelelo, tlhakanelodikobo le petelelo ya mo lenyalong.

en: It believes the violence was linked to the frustration of being in confined spaces, and the restriction of movement.
tsn: E dumela gore tirisodikgoka e, e ka golagangwa le tlhobaelo ya go nna mo mafelong a a pitlaganeng, le thibelo ya motsamao.

en: Police said they received at least 2 300 calls for help related to gender-based violence during the first week of the 21-day national lockdown.
tsn: Sepodisi sa re se amogetse bonnye jwa megala e le 2 300 ya go kopa thuso e e amanang le tirisodikgoka ya bong mo bekeng ya ntlha ya matsatsi a bosetšhaba a kiletsometsamao.

en: One woman killed every 3 hours in South Africa.
tsn: Mosadi a le mongwe o bolawa mo diureng di le 3 mo Aforikaborwa.

en: Murders increased during lockdown.
tsn: Palo ya dipolao e oketsegile ka nako ya kiletsometsao

en: Police Minister, Bheki Cele, says there’s a link between the abuse of alcohol and a spike in crime, including Gender Based Violence.
tsn: Tona ya Sepodisi, Bheki Cele, a re go na le kgolagano magareng ga tiriso e e botlhaswa ya nnotagi le tlhagogo ya bosenyi, go akaretsa tiridikgoka e e ikaegile ka bong.

en: Cele believes the availability of alcohol also plays a role in people contravening #lockdown regulations.
tsn: Cele o dumela gore go nna teng ga bojalwa le gona go na le seabe mo go sa obameleng melawana ya kiletsometsao ga batho.

en: South Africa’s children say the COVID-19 lockdown has left them feeling sad, lonely and eager to return to life as it was before the pandemic.
tsn: Bana ba Aforikaborwa ba re kiletsometsamao ka ntlha ya COVID-19 e ba tlogetse ba utlwile botlhoko, ba jelwe ke bodutu mme ba batla go boela kwa mokgweng o botshelo bo neng bo le ka teng pele ga leroborobo.

en: At midnight on Thursday, it will be a year since the country officially went under lockdown.
tsn: Ka bosigogare jwa Labone, e tlaa be e le ngwaga fa e sale naga ya rona e ne tsena ka fa tlase ga melawana ya kiletsometsao.

en: Children says the lockdown has taken away some of the things they value most, such as interacting with friends at school and visiting the playground.
tsn: Bana ba re melawana ya kiletsometsao e ba tseetse dilo di le dintsi tse ba di ratang thata, jaaka go kopana le ditsala kwa sekolong le go etela mabala a go tshameka.

en: Above all, they despise the wearing of masks.
tsn: Go feta dilo tse tsotlhe, batlhoile go apara dimaseke.

en: It’s a long time since the virus is out there and you have to wear masks because the virus will go into you and you will get sick.
tsn: E setse e le nako e telele mogare o o le teng, mme o tshwanetse go apara dimaseke ka ntlha ya gore mogare o o tlaa go tsena o mme o tlaa simolola go lwala.

en: I don’t like wearing masks because then you can’t breathe a lot.
tsn: Ga ke rate go apara dimaseke ka gonne o ka se kgone go hema sentle.

en: I miss hugging my friends, says one child.
tsn: Ke tlhologeletswe go atla ditsala tsa me, ga bua mongwe wa bana.

en: Adds another: Last year wasn’t a year that I liked a lot because of the virus, people were dying and we had to stay inside.
tsn: Yo mongwe a tlaleletsa: Ngwaga o o fetileng e ne e se ngwaga o ke o ratang thata ka ntlha ya mogare, batho ba ne ba tlhokafala mme re ne re tshwanetse go nna ka mo matlong.

en: I hate it because it doesn’t let me go, it lets me stay.
tsn: Ke e tlhoile gonne ga e ntetle go tsamaya mme e ntetla gore ke dule.

en: I want to hug them and I want to stay with the people.
tsn: Ke batla go ba atla mme ke batla go nna le batho.

en: I would like to say to the president, to not toughen up the lockdown because we need to go to school.
tsn: Ke rata go raya moporesitente ke re, a seke a gagamatsa melawana ya kiletsometsamao ka ntlha ya gore re tlhoka go ya kwa sekolong.

en: The country is currently under level one lockdown, which has much more relaxed regulations.
tsn: Ga jaana, naga e e ka fa tlase ga logato lwa ntlha lwa kiletsometsao, le le nang le melawana e e sa gagamalang thata.

en: However, the wearing of mask, social distancing and sanitising or/and regular washing of hands are still mandatory.
tsn: Legale, go apara dimaseke, go katogana le go dirisa sebolayamegare/go tlhapa matsogo nako le nako e santse e le patelesego.

en: So far, South Africa has recorded more than 1.5 million cases and more than 52 000, amid concerns of a third wave of infections soon.
tsn: Go fitlha ga jaana, Aforikaborwa e na le dikgetse tse di fetang dimilione di le 52 000, mo gare ga matshwenyego a ditshwaetsego tsa lekhubu la boraro tse di tlaa simololang mo nakong e e sa fediseng pelo.

en: The National Institute of Communicable Disease (NICD) recently warned that mass gatherings and social events over the Easter holidays could trigger the third wave.
tsn: Setheo sa Bosetšhaba sa bolwetse jo bo tshelanwang (NICD) se tsibositse mo malobeng  gore dikokoano le ditiragalo tsa loago ka nako ya Pasekeka di ka tsosa lekhubu la boraro.

en: Citizens have been urged to take the necessary COVID-19 health protocols over the Easter holidays to avoid a fresh surge.
tsn: Baagi ba rotloeditswe go tsaya dikgato tse di tlhokegang tsa boitekanelo tsa go itlhokomela kgatlhanong le COVID-19 ka nako ya Paseka go thibela tlhagogo e e ntšhwa.

en: The No Zoom policy for this year’s Oscars ceremony is proving a headache for multiple nominees who live outside the United States and who are still under pandemic restrictions, according to Hollywood publications.
tsn: Pholisi e e thibelang tiriso ya Zoom kwa moletlong wa di Oscar wa ngwaga o, e opisa batho ba ba tlhophilweng ba le bantsi, ba ba nnang kwa ntle ga United Stated ditlhogo, le ba ba sa ntseng ba le ka fa tlase ga melawana ya thibelo ya leroborobo, go ya ka baphasalatsi ba kwa Hollywood.

en: Variety and Deadline Hollywood reported on Wednesday that publicists and some studio executives have complained to the film academy about logistics, costs and quarantine issues raised by the decision to bar nominees from taking part in the ceremony remotely.
tsn: Variety & Deadline ya kwa Hollywood e begile ka Laboraro gore baphasalatsi le bakhuduthamaga ba ba rileng ba ngongoregile go Akatemi ya difilimi ka ga dithulaganyo, ditshenyegelo le dintlha tsa ikgapelothoko tse di tlhagisitsweng ke tshwetso ya go thibela batlhophiwa go tsaya karolo mo moletlong le fa ba le kgakala.

en: The Academy of Motion Picture Arts and Sciences, which organizes the ceremony, did not return a request for comment on the reports.
tsn: Akatemi ya Motion Picture Arts & Sciences, e e rulaganyang moletlo, ga e a araba kopo ya ditshwaelo mo dipegong.

en: Due to the coronavirus pandemic, the April 25 show to hand out the highest honors in the movie industry will be held both at Union Station in Downtown Los Angeles and the traditional home of the Academy Awards at the Dolby Theatre in Hollywood.
tsn: Ka ntlha ya leroborobo la mogare wa corona, moletlo wa di 25 tsa Moranang, wa go neela ka sekgele se segolo sa tlotla mo intasetering ya filimi, o tlaa tshwarwelwa kwa Union Station kwa toropong ya kwa Los Angeles le kwa legaeng le le tlwaeleging la dikgele tsa Akatemi kwa bobogelong jwa Dolby kwa Hollywood.

en: Producers said last week that there will not be an option to Zoom in for the show and encouraged nominees to attend in person.
tsn: Bantshakuno ba buile mo bekeng e e fetileng gore ga go kitla go nna le tsela ya go bogela lenaneo le ka Zoom mme ba rotloeditse batlhophiwa go nna teng ka namana.

en: At least nine nominees, including Promising Young Woman director Emerald Fennell and star Carey Mulligan, live in Britain.
tsn: Bonnye, batlhophiwa ba le robongwe, go akaretsa mokaedi wa “Young Woman”, Emerald Fennell le naledi Carey Mulligan, ba nna kwa Britain.

en: England next week is expected to ban nonessential international travel until mid-May.
tsn: England mo bekeng e e tlang e solofetswe go thibela maeto a kwa dinageng di sele a a seng botlhokwa go fitlhela fa kgwedi ya Motsheganong e le mo magareng.

en: Representatives of the five international feature films submitted by Denmark, Hong Kong, Romania, Tunisia and Bosnia could also face hurdles getting to Los Angeles, Variety and Deadline noted.
tsn: Baemedi ba difilimi di le tlhano tsa boditšhabatšhaba tse di rometsweng ke Denmark, Hong Kong, Romania, Tunisia le Bosnia ba ka iphitlhela ba na le mathata a go fitlha kwa Los Angeles, go buile Variety & Deadline.

en: Some of the other 200 or so nominees will be working on productions that require quarantine or living in restricted bubbles with cast and crew, the publications said.
tsn: Bangwe ba batlhophiwa ba le 200 ba tlaa bo ba dira mo tlhagisong e e tlhokang gore ba katoge batho kgotsa ba dule ba itlhaotse mmogo le badira difilimi. Diphasalatso di kaile jalo.

en: Visitors to California are currently expected to quarantine for 10 days.
tsn: Baeng ba ba etelang kwa California ba solofetswe go ikgapela kwa thoko malatsi a le 10.

en: Travelers to nations outside the United States are also subject to varying quarantine requirements.
tsn: Batho ba ba tsayang maeto a kwa ntle ga United States le bona ba solofetswe go latela melao e e farologaneng ya go ikgapela kwa thoko.

en: Variety said a meeting this week to discuss the issues between the Academy, movie studio executives and publicists had been cancelled.
tsn: Variety e rile, kopano ya mo bekeng e, ya go bua ka merero e e magareng ga Akatemi, bakhuduthamaga ba setudio sa difilimi le baphasalatsi e phimotswe.

en: Other awards shows in recent months have replaced the usual in-person gatherings at gala dinners and on stage with pre-recorded appearances or virtual events, or a combination of those with small in-person gatherings.
tsn: Mananeo a mangwe a dikabelo a tsene mo legatong la dikokoano tsa namana tsa difitlholo tsa Gala le tsa mo seraleng ka go dirisa ditiragalo tse di rekotilweng pele ga nako, kgotsa dikopano tsa mo mafaratlhatlheng, kgotsa kopano ya dintlha tse pedi tse, ka palo e nnye ya dikopano tsa namana.

en: But television audiences have slumped, with the Golden Globes and the Grammys attracting the smallest numbers in decades.
tsn: Fela palo ya babogedi ba thelebišhene e ile kwa tlase, fa meletlo ya dikgele ya Golden Globes  le di Grammy e ntse e ngoka palo e nnye mo dingwagasomeng tse dintsi.

en: Jazz musician Harry Connick Jr. is showcasing a spiritual side with his new album, Alone With My Faith.
tsn: Sebini sa mmino wa Jazz Harry Connick Jr. o bontsha letlhakore la alebamo ya gagwe e ntšhwa, “Alone With My Faith”.

en: Connick Jr. created the album in his home studio during the pandemic, playing all the instruments, recording all background vocals and doing the engineering.
tsn: Connick Jr. o  dirile alebamo e  kwa setudiong sa gagwe sa kwa gae ka nako ya leroborobo, a tshameka mefuta yotlhe ya diletswa, a rekota mantswe a a opelang kwa lemoragong, a dira gape le boenjenere.

en: The singer said the process acted as therapy during uncertain times.
tsn: Seopedi se sa re tsamaiso e, e dirile jaaka kalafi ka dinako tse di neng di sa tlhomama.

en: This was a case where the music itself was actually helping me get through this time, and that’s really rare, he said.
tsn: E ke nako e ka yona mmino o neng o nthusa go kgotlhelela mo nakong eo, mme seo ga se a tlwaelega, a rialo.

en: The New Orleans native described the 13-track project as a mix of Christian and faith-based songs intended for those who need help accessing their faith to get them through the last year.
tsn: Motho yo o tlholegileng kwa New Orleans yo, o tlhalositse porojeke ya dipina di le 13 jaaka motswako wa dipina tsa sekeresete le tsa sedumedi tse di diretsweng go thusa ba ba tlhokang thuso ya go fitlhelela tumelo ya bona go ba goga mo ngwaga o o fetileng.

en: Connick said the album, released earlier this month, is an honest look at how most people navigated life during quarantine.
tsn: Connick a re alebamo e e golotsweng mo tshimologong ya kgwedi e, e botlhokwa go lebelela gore batho ba le bantsi ba ne ba tshela jang ka nako ya go ikgapela kwa thoko.

en: This is a really truthful look at what I, and I think a lot of other people who might listen to it, are going through and just, just went through, he said.
tsn: Se ke tebo e e nepagetseng ya se nna, mme ke akanya gore le bontsi jwa batho ba bangwe ba ba ka e reetsang, ba itemogelang sona, se ba setseng ba itemogetse sona, o buile jalo.

en: Facebook Inc said on Wednesday it had blocked a group of hackers in China who used the platform to target Uighurs living abroad with links to malware that would infect their devices and enable surveillance.
tsn: Facebook Inc e rile ka Laboraro, e thibetse setlhopha sa batho ba ba tsenang mo dikhomputareng tsa batho kwa China, ba ba dirisitseng polatefomo e go tlhasela ma Uighur a a nnang kwa dinageng tsa kwa ntle ba ba nang le kgolagano le serweboleta sa thibotshenyo se se ka tshwaetsang  didirisiwa tsa bona mme sa letla gore ba kgone ba lebelela.

en: The social media company said the hackers, known as Earth Empusa or Evil Eye in the security industry, targeted activists, journalists and dissidents who were predominantly Uighurs, a largely Muslim ethnic group facing persecution in China.
tsn: Setlamo sa media wa botsalano sa re batho ba ba tsenang mo dikhomputareng tsa batho, ba ba  itsegeng jaaka Earth Empusa kgotsa Evil Eye mo madirelong a pabalesego, ba tlhasetse balweladiphetogo le babegakgang ba e neng e le  diUighur, setlhopha se segolo sa morafe wa mamoseleme, se se neng se lebane le dipogiso kwa China.

en: Facebook said there were less than 500 targets, who were largely from the Xinjiang region but were primarily living abroad in countries including Turkey, Kazakhstan, the United States, Syria, Australia and Canada.
tsn: Facebook e rile go ne go na le batho ba ba tlhasetsweng ba palo ya bona e leng kwa tlase ga 500, ba ba tswang kwa kgaolong ya Xinjiang mme ba ne ba tshela kwa moseja, kwa dinageng tse di akaretsang Turkey, Kazakhstan, United States, Syria, Australia le Canada.

en: It said the majority of the hackers activity occurred away from Facebook and that they used the site to share links to malicious websites rather than directly sharing the malware on the platform.
tsn: E rile bontsi jwa tiro ya batho ba ba tsenang mo dikhomputareng tsa batho e diragetse kwa ntle ga Facebook le gore ba dirisitse webosaete go neelana ka tsela ya go tsena mo diwebosaeteng tse di sa siamang, gona le gore ba abelane ka serwebololeta sa thibotshenyo ka tlhamalalo mo polatefomong.

en: This activity had the hallmarks of a well-resourced and persistent operation, while obfuscating who’s behind it, Facebook cybersecurity investigators said in a blog post.
tsn: Tiragalo eno e ne e na le letshwao la tiro e e nang le diridiswa tse di rulagantsweng sentle le tiriso e e tswelelang, fa ba ntse ba akabatsa yo o nang le seabe mo go yona, babatlasisi ba polokesego ya mafaratlhatlha ba Facebook ba buile jalo mo bolokhong.

en: Facebook said the hacking group used fake Facebook accounts to pose as fictitious journalists, students, human rights advocates or members of the Uighur community to build trust with their targets and trick them into clicking malicious links that would install spying software on their devices.
tsn: Facebook ya re setlhopha sa batho ba ba tsenang mo dikhomputareng tsa batho se dirisitse diakhaonto tsa Facebook tsa mokokotelo go dira jaaka e kete ke babegadikgang, baithuti, balwela ditshwanelo tsa batho kgotsa ditokololo tsa baagi ba Uighur go aga boikanyego le bona mme morago ba ba tsietse gore ba tobetse di linke tse di tlaa tsenyang dirweboletsa tsa go tlhola mo didirisweng tsa bona.

en: It said hackers both set up malicious websites using look-alike domains for popular Uighur and Turkish news sites and compromised legitimate websites visited by the targets.
tsn: E rile, batho ba ba tsenang mo dikhomputareng tsa batho ba aga diwebosaete tse di sa siamang ka go dirisa diwebosaete tse di batlileng di tshwana le tse di itsegeng thata tsa dikgang tsa, Uighur, le Turkey mme gape ba senya diwebosaete tse di mo molaong tse di etelwang ke batho ba ba ikaeletseng go ba tlhasela.

en: Facebook also found websites created by the group to mimic third-party Android app stores with Uighur-themed apps, like a prayer app and dictionary app, containing malware.
tsn: Facebook e fitlhetse gape diwebosaete tse di tlhamilweng go ya ka setlhopha sa go etsisa mabenkele a diapp a Android, a a nang le di app tsa Uighur tse di tshwanang le app ya thapelo le app ya thanodi, e e nang le serweboleta sa thibotshenyo.

en: Facebook said its investigation found two Chinese companies, Beijing Best United Technology Co Ltd (Best Lh) and Dalian 9Rush Technology Co Ltd (9Rush) had developed the Android tooling deployed by the group.
tsn: Facebook ya re patlisiso ya yona e fitlhetse gore, ditlamo tse pedi tsa kwa China, Beijing Best United Technology Co Ltd (Best Lh ) le Dalian 9Rush Technology Co Ltd (9rush) di tlhamile sediriswa sa Android se se rometsweng ke setlhopha.

en: The Chinese Embassy in Washington did not immediately return a message seeking comment on Facebooks report.
tsn: Embasi ya Machaena ya kwa Washington ga e a busa molaetsa o o neng o batla tshwaelo ka ga pegelo ya Facebook ka bonako..

en: Beijing routinely denies allegations of cyber espionage.
tsn: Beijing e ganana le ditatofatso tsa botlhodi jwa tirisointhanete.

en: Reuters was not immediately able to locate contact information for Dalian 9Rush Technology Co Ltd.
tsn: Reuters ga e a kgona go bona tshedimosetso ya go ikgolaganya le Dalian 9Rush Technology Co Ltd.

en: A man who answered the number listed for Beijing Best United Technology Co Ltd hung up.
tsn: Monna yo o arabileng nomoro ya mogala e e kwadilweng gore ke ya Beijing Best United Technology Co Ltd, o ba beetse mogala fa fatshe.

en: Western governments are seeking to hold Beijing accountable for mass detentions of Muslim Uighurs in north-western China, where the United States says China is committing genocide.
tsn: Dipuso tsa kwa Bophirima di batla gore Beijing e tseye maikarabelo a go golega bontsi jwa mamoselemo a Uighurs kwa bokone Bophirima kwa China, kwa United States e reng China e tlhola polao ya mogoso.

en: China denies all accusations of abuse and says its camps provide vocational training and are needed to fight extremism.
tsn: China e ganetsa ditatofatso tsotlhe tsa tshotlako mme ya re dikampa tsa bona di tlamela ka katiso ya diatla mme di a tlhokega go lwantsha botlhokakaelo.

en: The United Nations estimates that up to 1 million people, mainly Uighurs, have been detained in the Xinjiang camps.
tsn: Kopano ya boditšhaba e phopholetsa gore batho ba ka nna milione e le 1, segolobogolo Uighur, ba setse ba tlhatlhetswe kwa dikampeng tsa kwa Xinjiang.

en: Facebook said it had removed the groups accounts, which numbered less than 100, and had blocked the sharing of the malicious domains and was notifying people it believed were targets.
tsn: Facebook  e rile e tlositse diakhaonto tsa ditlhopha, tse nomoro ya tsona e leng kwa tlase ga 100, mme e thibetse go abelana ka diwebosaete tse di sa siamang, gape e ne e itsise batho ba e dumelang gore ba ikaeletswe go tlhaselwa.

en: Black South Africans were more willing to sacrifice their rights to stop the spread of the coronavirus, than their white counterparts.
tsn: MaAforikaborwa ba bantsho ba ne ba dumela go ntsha ditshwanelo tsa bona setlhabelo  go thibela kanamo ya mogare wa corona, go na le  basweu.

en: This is according to the Human Sciences and Research Council (HSRC) in a study conducted during the lockdown in 2020.
tsn: Se ke ke go ya ka khansele ya Disaense tsa Setho le Patlisiso (Council (HSRC) mo patlisisong e e dirilweng ka nako ya kiletsometsamo ka 2020.

en: The HSRC released the findings of its research titled: Who is willing to sacrifice human rights in the context of COVID in a webinar in Pretoria.
tsn: HSRC e golotse diphitlhelelo tsa dipatlisiso tse setlhogo sa yona e reng: Ke mang yo o ratang go ntsha ditshwanelo tsa gagwe tsa botho setlhabelo mo bokaong jwa COVID, mo bobinareng kwa Pretoria.

en: The findings come as the country is about to mark one year since the lockdown was instituted to curb the spread of COVID-19.
tsn: Diphitlhelelo tse di tla nako e naga e tshwayang ngwaga fa e sale go tsenngwa tirisong melawana ya kiletsometsamao  go thibela go anama ga COVID-19.

en: National Assembly focuses on how COVID-19 affected the rights of South Africans.
tsn: Kokoano ya bosetšhaba e tlhoma mogopolo mo ditseleng tse ka tsona COVID-19 e amileng ditshwanelo tsa Maaforikaborwa.

en: The study was conducted in three phases: April to May; August to October; and December 2020 to January 2021.
tsn: Patlisiso e e ne e dirwa ka dikgato di le tharo: Moranang go fitlha ka Motsheganong; Phatwe le Diphalane; le Sedimonthole 2020 go fitlha ka Ferikgong 2021.

en: The HSRCs Divisional Research Executive Professor Narnia Bohler-Muller says, 78% of South Africans were willing to sacrifice their human rights to stop the spread of the virus.
tsn: Khuduthamaga ya lephata la dipatlisiso kwa HSRC Moporofesara Narnia Bohler-Muller a re, 78% ya Maaforikaborwa ba ne ba batla go ntsha ditshwanelo tsa bona tsa botho setlhabelo go thibela go anama ga mogare.

en: So, 78% in the third round
tsn: Ka jalo, 78% mo legatong la boraro.

en: So, there wasn’t much difference across the rounds as to this general question that is: are you willing to sacrifice your rights?
tsn: Ka jalo, go ne go sena pharologano e kalo mo magatong fa go tliwa mo potsong e e reng: a o dumela go ntsha ditshwanelo tsa gago setlhabelo.

en: But where we broke down to which rights you were willing to sacrifice, then the outcomes were slightly different.
tsn: Mme fa re e kgaoganya ka gore: ke ditshwanelo dife tse o batlang go dintsha setlhabelo, dipoelo di ne di farologana go le gonnye.

en: Demographics:
tsn: Palo ya batho

en: Prof Bohler-Muller says according to demographics, it has been found that black South Africans were more willing to sacrifice their rights to stop the spread of the virus compared to their white counterparts.
tsn: Mop Bohler-Muller a re go ya ka palo ya batho, go fitlhetswe gore bantsho ba Aforikaborwa ba ne ba dumela go ntsha ditshwanelo tsa bona setlhabelo go thibela go anama ga mogare fa go bapisiwa le basweu.

en: The most demographic group, most willing to sacrifice their rights were black South Africans at 81%.
tsn: Bontsi jwa batho ba ba neng ba ikemiseditse go ntsha ditshwanelo tsa bona setlhabelo e ne e le bantsho ba Aforikaborwa ka 81%.

en: The demographic in South Africa that were least willing to sacrifice their rights were white South Africans at 58%.
tsn: Palo ya batho mo Aforikaborwa e e neng e sa ikemisetsa go ntsha ditshwanelo tsa bona setlhabelo e ne e le basweu ba Aforikaborwa ka 58%.

en: Chief Executive Officer of the South African Human Rights Commission, Advocate Tseliso Thipanyane, says the commission has seen an increase in the number of complaints of human rights violations during the lockdown.
tsn: Motlhankedimogolo wa Khomišene ya Ditshwanelo tsa Botho ya Aforikaborwa, Mmueledi Tseliso Thipanyane a re, Khomišene e bone tlhatlogo ya palo ya dingongorego tsa dikgatako tsa ditshwanelo tsa botho ka nako ya kiletso metsamao.

en: So yes, the number of complaints did increase because of the peculiar nature of COVID-19 that we are now limiting the rights.
tsn: Ee, palo ya dingongorego e ne ya oketsega ka ntlha ya mofuta wa bolwetse o COVID-19 e leng ona, jaanong re lekanyetsa ditshwanelo tsa botho.

en: The other thing which concerns us, which we are also looking at under small offences; what might happen to people who got the criminal record for not wearing a mask because then are you going to have a policy where after a certain period of time, those records will be expunged?
tsn: Sengwe gape se se re tshwenyang, se re se lebeletseng ka fa tlase ga ditlolomolao tse di nnye; ke eng se se ka diragalang go batho ba ba nang le rekoto ya bosenyi ka ntlha ya go se apare maseke, a o tlile go nna le pholisi e e tla reng kwa morago ga nako e e beilweng, direkoto tseo di tloswe?.

en: Human Rights and Social Justice Activist, Mark Heywood, says respect for and promotion of human rights will improve the country’s COVID-19 response.
tsn: Molweladiphetogo wa ditshwanelo tsa Botho le bosiamisi jwa loago, Mark Heywood a re tlotlo ya, le go rotloetsa ditshwanelo tsa botho go tlaa tokafatsa tsibogo ya naga ya COVID-19.

en: So there is a positive side that has to be much better understood.
tsn: Ka jalo go na le letlhakore le le siameng le le tshwanetseng go tlhaloganngwa botoka.

en: There is positive state obligation when it comes to socio-economic rights whose regression makes people more vulnerable to COVID-19, to spreading COVID-19 and to dying of COVID-19.
tsn: Go na le maikarabelo a a siameng a puso fa go tliwa mo ditshwanelong tsa ikonomi le loago batho tse poelo morago ya tsona e dirang gore batho ba iphitlhele ba tsenwa ke COVID-19 botlhofo, go phasalatsa COVID-19 le go tlhokafala ka ntlha ya COVID-19.

en: The HSRC and the Human Rights Commission say, despite, there being important players in research and protection of human rights, the national Coronavirus Command Council, chaired by President Cyril Ramaphosa, has never invited them to give input on how to deal with COVID-19.
tsn: HSRC le Khomišene ya Ditshwanelo tsa botho, ya re, le fa go na le batsayakarolo ba ba botlhokwa mo patlisisong le tshireletso ya ditshwanelo tsa botho, khansele ya bosetšhaba ya mogare wa corona, e modulasetulo wa yona e leng moporesitente Cyril Ramaphosa, ga e ise e ba laletse go neelana ka tshwaelo ka ga tsela ya go samagana le COVID-19.

en: The right to go to place of worship was the right South Africans were most willing to sacrifice.
tsn: Tshwanelo ya go ya kwa mafelong a kobamelo, ke tshwanelo e Maaforikaborwa a le mantsi a neng a ikemiseditse go e ntsha setlhabelo.

en: George Segal, the Oscar-nominated actor who sparred with Richard Burton in Who’s Afraid of Virginia Woolf, romanced Glenda Jackson in A Touch of Class and won laughs in the TV sitcom The Goldbergs, has died at the age of 87, his wife Sonia said on Tuesday.
tsn: George Segal, modiragatsi yo o neng a tlhophilwe kwa di Oscar, yo o neng a bakisana le Richard Burton mo  Who’s Afraid of Virginia Woolf, romanced Glenda Jackson in A Touch of Class and won laughs in the TV sitcom The Goldbergs a tlhokafetse ka dingwaga di le 87, mosadi wa gagwe Sonia o buile jalo ka Labobedi.

en: The family is devastated to announce that this morning George Segal passed away due to complications from bypass surgery, Sonia Segal said in a statement to entertainment outlets Variety and Deadline Hollywood.
tsn: Lelapa le utlwile botlhoko go bega gore mo mosong ono, George Segal o ne a tlhokafala ka ntlha ya marara a karo ya go fokotsa boima jwa mmele, Sonia Segal o rile jalo mo polelong le ba mafelo a boitapoloso Variety le Deadline Holywood.

en: Charming and witty, Segal excelled in dramatic and comedic roles and had a life-long passion for the banjo.
tsn: A ratega e bile a tletse metlae, Segal o ne a ntsha ga tshwene mo tiragatsong ya terama le terama ya ditshego mme o ne a le  lerato le le ntsi thata la banjo.

en: He performed at New York’s Carnegie Hall in 1981 with his group, the Beverly Hills Unlisted Jazz Band.
tsn: O diragaditse kwa holong ya Carnegie ka 1981 le setlhopha sa gagwe sa mmino wa Jazz, Beverly Hills Unlisted.

en: Segal’s acting career began on the New York stage and television in the early 1960s.
tsn: Tiro ya ga Segal ya bodiragatsi e simolotse kwa seraleng sa kwa New York nako le mo thelebišene mo tshimologong ya dingwaga tsa bo 1960.

en: He quickly moved into films, playing an artist in the star-studded ensemble drama Ship of Fools and a scheming, wily American corporal in a World War Two prisoner-of-war camp in King Rat in 1965.
tsn: O ne a tsena ka bonako mo go tsa difilimi, a tshameka jaaka modiragatsi mo terameng ya Ship of Fools le lenweenwee le le setlhogo la kwa Amerika, kwa kampeng ya ntwa ya Lefatshe ya bobedi mo King Rat ka 1965.

en: Two years later he earned an Academy Award nomination as best supporting actor in the harrowing, marital drama Who’s Afraid of Virginia Woolf? with Burton and Elizabeth Taylor.
tsn: Morago ga dingwaga tse pedi o amogetse tlhopho ya dikabelo tsa Akatemi jaaka modirigatsi yo o tshegetsang yo o gaisang mo terameng ya lenyalo “Who’s afraid of Virginia woolf”? le Burton le Elizabeth Taylor.

en: As cheering children and men frantically paddle their inflatable surfboard through the frothy Pacific waves onto the beach, one passenger placidly sits in the bow taking it all in a large, white goat.
tsn: Fa bana ba ba itumetseng le banna ba palama diboto tsa bona tsa go thuma tse di budulwang, ba tshamekela mo makhubung a metsi kwa lewatleng, mopalami a le mongwe o dutse kwa thoko mme o lebeleletse, podi e tshweu

en: California surfer Dana McGregor has always loved the thrill of catching a wave, but it wasn’t until he took his pet goat surfing with him one day that he truly found his calling.
tsn: Mothumi wa kwa California Dana McGregor, kgale e le motho yo o ratang go thuma mo makhubu a lewatle, fela o fitlheletse pitso ya gagwe ya nnete fa ne a tsamaile le podi ya gagwe go ya go thuma kwa lewatleng ka letsatsi lengwe.

en: I got one goat to clear my poison oak in the backyard
tsn: Ke tsere podi e le nngwe go tlosa botlhole jwa setlhare sa ouku mo jarateng ya me.

en: I decided to take it surfing on my birthday
tsn: Ke tsere tshwetso ya go e isa kwa lewatleng  go ya go thuma ka letsatsi la me la matsalo.

en: and then I just ended up surfing goats, recalled McGregor of the day his goat-surfing journey began almost ten years ago.
tsn: Mme ke ne ka feleletsa ke thuma le dipodi, go gakologelwa McGregor ka ga letsatsi le leeto la gagwe la go thuma mo makhubung le dipodi le simolotseng ka lona, dingwaga tse di lesome tse di fetileng.

en: McGregor, 42, now teaches children how to surf from Pismo Beach, north of Santa Barbara, using his pet goats Pismo and Grover to help them overcome their fear of the water.
tsn: McGregor wa dingwaga di le 42, jaanong o ruta bana go thuma go tswa kwa lewatleng la Pismo, kwa bokone jwa SANTA Barbara, ka go dirisa dipodi tsa gagwe, Pismo le Grover go ba thusa go kgona go fenya letshogo ya metsi.

en: When its your first time it feels scary but actually after you keep on doing it and doing it, its really fun, said 10-year-old Mileah Robbins, fresh from riding a wave with eight-year-old Pismo.
tsn: Fa e le lekgetlho la ntlha, go a tshosa mme fa o tswelela go e dira nako le nako, e monate, go bua Mileah Robbins wa dingwaga di le 10, e le gona a tswang mo lekhubung la metsi le Pismo wa dingwaga di le robedi.

en: The goats seem to enjoy it too, judging by Pismos relaxed expression as he hit the waves.
tsn: Go lebega e kete dipodi le tsona di a e rata, ke lebile ka mokgwa o  Pismo a iketlileng ka teng fa a tsena mo makhubung a metsi.

en: There’s a freedom in surfing that you can’t find just anywhere, said McGregor, hugging his goats as they stand on the boardwalk, attracting attention from children and other passers-by.
tsn: Go na le kgololosego mo go thumeng mo makhubung e o sekakeng wa e bona gongwe le gongwe fela, go bua McGregor, a atla dipodi tsa gagwe fa di eme mo tselaneng,, di ngoka bana le bafeti ka tsela.

en: You’re riding waves that God brings us, that bring healing and joy and freedom and peace into our lives so I want everyone to experience that.
tsn: O thuma mo makhubung a Modimo a re tlisetsang ona, a a tlisang pholo, boitumelo, kgololosego le kagiso mo matshelong a rona ka jalo, ke batla gore mongwe le mongwe a itemogele seo.

en: The battle of Cuito Cuanavale has paved the way for the liberation of Southern Africa.
tsn: Ntwa ya ga Cuito Cuanavale  tlhagotse tsela ya kgololesego ya Borwa jwa Aforika.

en: This is according to Arts, Sport and Culture Minister, Nathi Mthethwa.
tsn: Seno ke go ya ka Tona ya Botsweretshi, metshameko le setso, Nathi Mthethwa.

en: Mthethwa was speaking at the commemoration of the battle at Freedom Park in Pretoria on Tuesday.
tsn: Mthethwa ne a bua kwa segopotsong sa ntwa kwa Freedom Park kwa Pretoria ka Labobedi.

en: The battle expedited the liberation of Namibia, South Africa and the SADC region.
tsn: Ntwa e, e itlhaganedisitse kgololosego ya Namibia, Aforikaborwa le kgaolo ya SADC.

en: The battle of Cuito Cuanavale was fought on the banks of the Lomba River in Cuito Cuanavale, South-Eastern Angola.
tsn: Ntwa ya Cuito Cuanavale e ne e lwanwa mo dintshing tsa noka ya  Lomba kwa Cuito Cuanavale, kwa borwa botlhaba jwa  Angola.

en: It involved the late Jonas Savimbi-led rebel group, UNITA, assisted by the South African Defence Force against the Angolan army (FAPLA), who was assisted by Cuba, the Soviet Union and to a lesser extent East Germany.
tsn: E ne akaretsa setlhopha sa marabele sa ga moswi Jonas Savimbi  UNITA, ba thusiwa ke sesole sa Aforikaborwa kgatlhanong le Sesole sa kwa Angola (FAPLA), se se neng se thusiwa ke Cuba, Soviet Union le go le gonnye, botlhaba jwa Jeremane.

en: Eduardo Kondua, representing Angolan Ambassador to South Africa says the outcomes of the battle of Cuito Cuanavale were important for the SADC region.
tsn: Eduardo Kondua, yo o emetseng  moambasadara wa Angolo kwa Aforikaborwa re ditlamorago tsa ntwa ya Cuito Cuanavale di ne di le botlhokwa mo kgaolong ya SADC.

en: Indeed the results of Cuito Cuanavale campaign were crucial in persuading the leaders of South Africa’s national party to cut their losses.
