tsn: Setheo sa Serum sa India (SII), badiri ba ba golo thata mo lefatsheng ba moento, se dirile maikano a go neelana ka meento ya COVID-19 e ka nnang kana ka dibilione di le 2 go dinaga tsa letseno le le kwa tlase le le le mo magareng, ka bokana ka halofo bo tlaa fitlhelelwa fa ngwaga wa 2021 o ya kwa bokhutlong.

en: It has also come under pressure to meet the needs of other governments, including Britain, Canada and Saudi Arabia, amid AstraZeneca’s global production problems.
tsn: E nnile gape mo tlase ga kgatelelo ya go fitlhelela ditlhokego tsa dipuso tse dingwe, go akaretsa Britain, Canada le Saudi Arabia, magareng ga mathata a lefatshe ka bophara a go dira moento wa AstraZeneca.

en: A further initial hurdle to SIIs supply ambitions was India’s hesitation in placing firm orders, two sources said.
tsn: Ntlha e nngwe e e kgoreletsang maikalelo a ditlamelo a SIIS, ke ketsaetsego e India e nnileng le yona mo go tsenyeng dipeeletso tse di tsepameng, go bua metswedi e mebedi.

en: That could have allowed it to boost output of the AstraZeneca vaccine early, even though regulators had yet to approve it.
tsn: Se, se kabo se e letleletse go oketsa kungo ya moento wa AstraZeneca nako e sale teng, le fa batho ba ba bayang melao ba ne ba ise ba e amogele.

en: India spent months discussing the final price per dose and inked an initial purchase order roughly two weeks after Indias drug regulator approved the AstraZeneca shot, according to the sources.
tsn: India nako ya dikgwedi tse di ka tlhotlhwa e e ka nang le taolo ya go reka inked e e ka nnang dibeke di le pedi morago ga go amogela astrazeneca indias seritibatsi sa go laola, go ya ka metswedi.

en: At one point, SII ran out of space to store produced doses.
tsn: Mo ntlheng e e rileng, SII e feletswe ke leflo la go boloka meento.

en: That is why I chose not to pack more than 50 million doses, because I knew if I packed more than that, I would have to store it in my house, SII Chief Executive Adar Poonawalla told Reuters in January.
tsn: Ke ka moo ke tlhophileng gore ke seka ka paka meento e e fetang dimilione di le 50, ka gonne ke ne ke itse gore fa nka paka go feta moo, ke tlaa tshwanelwa ke go e boloka kwa ntlong ya me, Mokhuduthamaga wa SIIU Adar Poonawalla o boleletse Reuters ka Ferikgong.

en: He said he had spent 20 billion rupees ($272 million) on the 50 million doses that the company started stockpiling since around October.
tsn: O rile o dirisitse dibilione tse 20 rupees ($272, milione) go reka meento e le dimilione di le 50, tse setlamo se simolotseng go e kgobokanya go tloga ka kgwedi ya Diphalane.

en: Even now, the government only makes ad-hoc purchases from SII instead of agreeing a longer-term supply schedule, said one of the sources.
tsn: Le jaanong, puso e reka ditlamelo tsa nakwana go tswa kwa SIIU mo boemong jwa go tlamela ka thulaganyo ya paka telele, go buile mongwe wa metswedi.

en: SII has sought more than $400 million from the government to increase capacity, but no commitment has yet been made.
tsn: SII e kopile dimilione di le $400 go tswa kwa pusong go oketsa bokgoni, mme ga go na boitlamo bope jo bo dirilweng.

en: The health department and foreign ministry did not respond to requests for comment on issues of funding, purchasing delays and other aspects of Indias vaccination rollout.
tsn: Lefapha la Pholo le Lefapha la Merero ya Boditšhaba ga le a tsibogela dikopo tsa go tshwaela ka ga merero ya matlole, tiego ya ditheko le dintlha tse dingwe tsa go ntsha moento kwa India.

en: COVAX also did not green-light shipments to participating countries from SII until after the shot received WHO clearance in mid-February, said a source involved in the COVAX initiative.
tsn: Gape COVAX ga e a neelana ka tetla ya thomelo go dinaga tse di tsayang karolo mo SII go fitlha morago ga gore moento o amogelwe ke WHO fa kgwedi ya Tlhakole e le mo magareng, go buile motswedi o o amegang mo letsholong la COVAX.

en: The source said those delays meant tens of millions of additional doses that the SII could have produced between October and February never materialised.
tsn: Motswedi o o rile tiego e, e kaya gore dimilione tsa meento e e tlaleletsang e e kabong e dirilwe fa gare ga kgwedi ya Diphalane le Tlhakole, ga e a dirwa.

en: Gavi defended its decision to wait for proper approvals before going ahead with firm orders.
tsn: Gavi e sireleditse tshwetso ya bona ya go emela tetla e e tshwanetseng pele ba ka tswela pele ka dipeeletso tse di tsepameng.

en: And while it is looking for more suppliers, it conceded that much still depended on India’s vaccine makers who account for some 60% of global supplies.
tsn: Le fa e ntse e batlana le batlamedi ba bangwe, e amogetse gore dilo di le dintsi di santse di ikaegile ka badiri ba meento ba kwa India, ba ba tlamelang ka 60% ya meento lefatshe ka bophara.

en: COVAX has a deal to buy 1 billion-plus doses from the SII.
tsn: COVAX e dirile ditumalano tsa go reka meento e e ka fetang bilione e le 1 go tswa kwa SII.

en: But it has received less than a fifth of the 100 million or so doses of the SII-made AstraZeneca vaccine it had expected by May.
tsn: Fela e e amogetsweng kwa tlase ga botlhano ya dimilione di le 100 kgotsa ka jalo di ntse a sii-made astrazeneca moento go ne go solofetswe ka Motsheganong.

en: SII is also supposed to make millions of doses of the Novavax shot for COVAX.
tsn: SII gape e tshwanetse go dira dimilione tsa meento ya Novavax ya COVAX.

en: Gavi had hoped SII would fully resume vaccine deliveries to COVAX in May, but on Wednesday it said India’s COVID-19 crisis could affect that.
tsn: Gavi e ne e  solofetse  gore SII e tlaa tswelela go gorosa meento ya COVAX ka Motsheganong, mme ka Laboraro, e rile mathata a kwa India a COVID-19 a ka ama se.

en: We understand the ferocity of the virus in India at the current time, nevertheless we hope and expect deliveries to resume as soon as possible, it said in an email to Reuters.
tsn: Re tlhaloganya bosetlhogo jwa mogare mo India ka nako ya jaanong, le fa go le jalo re solofela go amogela ditlamelo ka bonako jo bo kgonegang, e buile mo emailing e e e romeletseng Reuters.

en: On Thursday India reported 200 739 infections over the past 24 hours, a seventh daily record in the last eight days, while 1 038 deaths took its toll to 173 123.
tsn: Ka Labone, India e begile dikgetse di le 200 739 tsa tshwaetsego mo diureng di le 24 tse di fetileng, rekoto ya bosupa ya letsatsi le letsatsi mo malatsing a le robedi, fa dintsho di le 1 038 di isitse palogotlhe ya dintsho go 173 123.

en: Its tally of 14.1 million infections is second only to the United States.
tsn: Palogotlhe ya ditshwaetsego di le dimilione di le 14.1 e ama United States fela.

en: Having originally aimed to cover 300 million of its highest-risk people by August, or just over a fifth of its 1.35 billion population, the government has now expanded that by another 100 million, with the promise to widen it further.
tsn: Le fa ba ne ba na le maikaelelo a go fitlhelela batho ba ba leng mo kotsing ba le dimilione di le 300, kgotsa go feta botlhano jwa baagi ba le dibilione di le 1.35 ka kgwedi ya Phatwe, , puso jaanong e atolositse palo e ka dimilione di le 100, ka tsholofetso ya go e oketsa go ya pele.

en: The United States is preparing for the possibility that a booster shot will be needed between nine to 12 months after people are initially vaccinated against COVID-19, a White House official said on Thursday.
tsn: United States e ipaakanyetsa kgonagalo ya gore go ka nna le tlhokego ya moento o mongwe gape magareng ga dikgwedi di le robongwe go ya go di le 12 morago ga gore batho ba entiwe kgatlhanong le COVID-19, modiredi wa White House o buile jalo ka Labone.

en: While the duration of immunity after vaccination is being studied, booster vaccines could be needed, David Kessler, chief science officer for President Joe Biden’s COVID-19 response task force told a congressional committee meeting.
tsn: Le fa bokgoni jwa mmele jwa go itwela kgatlhanong le malwetse morago ga moento bo santse bo le ka fa tlase ga dipatlisiso, moento o mongwe mo godimo ga oo o ka tswa o tlhokega, David Kessler, Motlhankedimogolo wa saense wa setlhopha sa COVID-19 sa ga Moporesitente Joe Biden o boleletse Komiti ya khonkerese kwa kopanong.

en: The current thinking is those who are more vulnerable will have to go first, he said.
tsn: Monagano wa jaanong jaana ke gore, ba o ba leng mo kotsing ba tlaa tshwanelwa ke go ya pele, o ne a bolela jalo.

en: Meanwhile, Pfizer Inc Chief Executive Albert Bourla said people will likely need a third booster dose of COVID-19 vaccines within 12 months and could need annual shots, CNBC reported based on his comments from April 1, which were made public on Thursday.
tsn: Re sa ntse re le foo, Mokhuduthamaga wa Pfizer, Albert Bourla a re batho ba ka tlhoka moento wa boraro wa COVID-19 mo dikgweding di le 12 mme gape ba ka tlhoka go entiwa ngwaga le ngwaga, CNBC e begile e lebisitse mo ditshwaelong tsa gagwe go tloga ka Moranang 1, tse di phasaladitsweng ka Labone.

en: Initial data has shown that vaccines from Moderna Inc and partners Pfizer Inc and BioNTech SE retain most of their effectiveness for at least six months, though for how much longer has not been determined.
tsn: Tshedimosetso e bontshitse gore meento e e tswang kwa Moderna Inc & Partners, Pfizer Inc le BioNTech SE e tlamela ka tshireletso ya dikgwedi di le thataro, le fa go ise go tlhomamisiwe gore go fitlha leng.

en: Even if that protection lasts far longer than six months, experts have said that rapidly spreading variants of the coronavirus and others that may emerge could lead to the need for regular booster shots similar to annual flu shots.
tsn: Le fa e le gore tshireletsego eo e nna go feta dikgwedi tse thataro, baitseanape ka kaile gore megare e mengwe ya khorona e e phasalatsegang ka bonako, le e mengwe e e ka tlhagogang, e ka dira gore batho ba tlhoke go entiwa nako le nako go tshwana le fa ba tsaya moento wa sefuba ngwaga le ngwaga.

en: The United States is also tracking infections in people who have been fully vaccinated, Rochelle Walensky, director of the US Centres of Disease Control and Prevention told the House subcommittee hearing.
tsn: United States e ntse gape e sala morago ditshwaetsego mo bathong ba ba entileng ka botlalo, Rochelle Walensky, Mokaedi wa Senthara ya go laola le go thibela malwetse kwa US o boleletse komitipotlana ya ntlo ya theetso.

en: Of 77 million people vaccinated in the United States, there have been 5 800 such breakthrough infections, Walensky said, including 396 people who required hospitalisation and 74 who died.
tsn: Go batho ba le dimilione di le 77 ba ba entileng kwa United States, go nnile le diphitlhelelo tsa go nna jalo di le 5 800, Walensky o buile jalo, go akaretsa batho ba le 396 ba ba neng ba tlhoka go isiwa kwa bookelong le ba le 74 ba ba tlhokafetseng.

en: Walensky said some of these infections have occurred because the vaccinated person did not mount a strong immune response.
tsn: Walensky o rile dingwe tsa ditshwaetso tse di diragetse ka gonne mmele wa motho yo o entileng o sa kgona go lwantsha malwetse.

en: But the concern is that in some cases, they are occurring in people infected by more contagious virus variants.
tsn: Fela matshwenyego ke gore mo mabakeng a mangwe, di diragala mo bathong ba ba tshwaeditsweng ke megare e e farologaneng e e kotsi.

en: Earlier this month, Pfizer and partner BioNTech said their vaccine was around 91% effective in preventing COVID-19, citing updated trial data that included more than 12 000 people fully inoculated for at least six months.
tsn: Mo tshimologong ya kgwedi e, Pfizer le modirammogo le yona, BioNTech ba rile moento wa bona o na le diperesente di le 90 tsa go thibela COVID-19, ba nopola tshedimosetso ya diteko e e tlhabolotsweng, e e akaretsang batho ba ba fetang 12 000 ba ba tlhabilweng ka botlalo mo nakong ya dikgwedi di le thataro.

en: Anthony Fauci, the top US infectious disease doctor, hopes US regulators will make a quick decision to lift a pause on the Johnson & Johnson vaccine and get that vaccine back on track, he said in an interview with Reuters on Thursday.
tsn: Anthony Fauci, ngaka ya maemo a a kwa godimo ya malwetse a a tshelanwang, o solofela gore badiramelao ba kwa US ba tlaa tsaya tshwetso ya ka bonako ya go tsholetsa kgaotso ya moento wa Johnson & Johnson le go o  busetsa mo tirisong, o buile jalo mo potsolotsong le Reuters ka Labone.

en: His comments come a day after a panel of advisers to the US Centres for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC) delayed a vote on whether to resume the J&J shots for at least a week, until it had more data on the risk.
tsn: Ditshwaelo tsa gagwe di tla letsatsi morago ga phanele ya bagakolodi ba senthara ya go laola malwetse le thibelo (CDC) ba diegisitse boutu ya go tswelela ka moento wa J & J mo bekeng eo, go fitlhelela e  nna le tshedimosetso e nngwe gape ka ga bokotsi jwa yona.

en: The United States earlier this week decided to pause distribution of the J&J vaccine to investigate six cases of a rare brain blood clot linked with low platelet counts in the blood.
tsn: United States go sale gale mo bekeng eno, e sweditse go kgaotsa kabelo ya moento wa J & J, go batlisisa dikgetse di le thataro tsa tsa go rema ga madi mo bobokong, e e golaganngwang le  polatelete e e kwa tlase mo mading.

en: Fauci said the pause was an indication that the CDC and the Food and Drug Administration take safety very seriously.
tsn: Fauci o rile kgaotso e ne e le sesupo sa gore CDC le tsamaiso ya dijo le diritibatsi di tsaya tshireletsego ka tlhoafalo.

en: I hope they make the conclusion of this quickly, and get back on track, he said.
tsn: Ke solofela gore ba tlaa tsaya tshwetso ya ka bonako mo go se, mme ba boele mo tseleng, o buile jalo.

en: And I believe they will.
tsn: Mme ke dumela gore ba tlaa dira jalo.

en: Fauci, who is director of the National Institute of Allergy and Infectious Diseases and chief medical adviser to the White House, said he worried about the effects of a prolonged delay.
tsn: Fauci, yo e leng Mokaedi wa Setheo sa Bosetšhaba sa aleji le malwetse a a tshelanwang le mogakolodi wa tsa kalafi wa kwa White House, a re o ne a tshwenyegile ka ga ditlamorago tsa go diegisiwa nako e telele.

en: The concern is that the longer you draw it out, the more there will be concern about not only that vaccine but it might even have an impact on vaccine hesitancy in general, he said.
tsn: Tlhobaelo ke gore fa e diegisiwa nako e e telele, ke moo go tlaa nnang le matshwenyego, e seng fela ka ga moento mme e ka baka go okaoka ka ga moento ka kakaretso, o buile jalo.

en: Once back on track he said, I think we’ve just got to continue to emphasize that this is a very efficacious vaccine and could be used, and be very, very valuable on the global scene.
tsn: Fa e setse e boetse mo tseleng, a re, ke akanya gore re tshwanetse go tswelela ka go gatelela gore ke moento o o nang le bokgoni thata mme o ka dirisiwa, e bile o ka nna le boleng jo bo kwa godimo thata mo lefatsheng ka bophara.

en: The blood clots associated with the J&J vaccine bear close resemblance to cases seen in Europe with the AstraZeneca PLC vaccine, and some countries in Europe are already backing away from using both.
tsn: Go rema ga madi go go amanangwang le moento wa J & J, go batla go tshwana le dikgetse tse di bonweng kwa Europe ka moento wa AstraZeneca PLC, mme dinaga tse dingwe kwa Europe di setse di simolotse go ikgatholosa go dirisa meento e ka bobedi.

en: Denmark on Wednesday announced it would stop using AstraZenecas vaccine altogether.
tsn: Denmark ka Laboraro e dirile kitsiso ya gore e tlaa emisa go dirisa moento o o AstraZenecas gotlhelele.

en: Asked if such moves may be premature, Fauci said, I think in many respects it is, at least until countries find out whether or not the events are truly occurring at a higher rate than would normally occur in the population.
tsn: Fa a bodiwa gore a dikgato tseo di tswere pele ga nako kgotsa jang, Fauci o rile, ke akanya gore mo mabekeng a mantsi go ntse jalo, bobotlana go fitlhelela dinaga di lemoga gore a ditiragalo tse di diragala ka kelo e e kwa godimo go feta ka mokgwa wa gale mo baaging.

en: The blood clots have not been seen with the Moderna Inc and the BioNTech/Pfizer Inc vaccines, which are made using a different type of technology called mRNA.
tsn: Go rema ga madi ga go ise bonwe ka tiriso ya meento ya Moderna Inc le ya BioNTech/Pfizer Inc, tse di dirilweng ka go dirisa mefuta e e farologaneng ya thekenoloji e e bidiwang mRNA.

en: Fauci said countries that do not have other options may have to weigh the risks of the vaccine versus the risk of COVID-19, which has also been linked with the same type of brain blood clots.
tsn: Fauci o rile, dinaga tse di se nang meento e mengwe di tlaa tshwanelwa ke go tlhola bokotsi jwa moento kgatlhanong le matshosetsi a COVID-19, e le yona e golagantsweng le mofuta o o tshwanang wa go rema ga madi mo bobokong.

en: If you have alternative vaccines, fine, but if you don’t, you may need to say you know, it’s a very, very small risk, he said.
tsn: Fa o na le meento e mengwe, go siame, mme fa o sena yona, o ka tlhoka go bua ka gore o a itse, ke kotsi e nnye thata, o buile jalo.

en: That will be a judgment call that will be made in the future.
tsn: Seo e tlaa nna kopo ya katlholo e e tlaa dirwang mo isagweng.

en: South Africa has recorded 1 372 new coronavirus infections in the last 24-hour cycle, taking the total number to 1 562 931.
tsn: Aforikaborwa e rekotile ditshwaetsego tse dintšhwa tsa mogare wa khorona tse 1 372 mo diureng di le 24 tse di fetileng, mme di isa palogotlhe go 1 562 931.

en: The country has also recorded 73 new COVID-19 related fatalities on Thursday.
tsn: Naga e le yona e begile dikgetse di le 73 tse di ntšhwa tsa dintsho tse di amanang COVID-19 ka Labone.

en: This brings the total number of deaths to 53 571.
tsn: Se se tlisa palogotlhe ya dintsho go 53 571.

en: Regrettably, we report 73 more COVID-19 related deaths: Eastern Cape 13, Free State 6, Gauteng 16, Kwa-Zulu Natal 20, Limpopo 8, Mpumalanga 4, North-West 0, Northern Cape 1 and Western Cape 5, says Dr Mkhize.
tsn: Ka maswabi, re bega dintsho tse dingwe di le 73 tse di amanang le COVID-19: Kapa Botlhaba 13, Foreisetata 6, Gauteng 16, Kwa-Zulu Natal 20, Limpopo 8, Mpumalanga 4, Bokone Bophirima 0, Kapa Bokone 1 le Kapa Bophirima 5, go buile Ngaka Mkhize.

en: Recoveries stand at 1 488 060.
tsn: Palo ya pholo e eme go 1 488 060.

en: The cumulative number of tests conducted to date is 10 259 664.
tsn: Palo e e golang ya diteko tse di dirilweng go fitlha ga jaana e fitlha go 10 259 664.

en: The number of healthcare workers vaccinated under the Sisonke Protocol is 292 623.
tsn: Palo ya badiri ba tlhokomelo ya boitekanelo ba ba entilweng go ya ka porotokolo ya Sisonke ke 292 623.

en: As of today, the total number of confirmed COVID19 cases is 1 562 931 the total number of deaths is 53 571 the total number of recoveries is 1 488 060.
tsn: Go fitlhelela gompieno, palogotlhe ya dikgetse tse di netefaditsweng tsa COVID-19 ke 1 562 931 palogotlhe ya dintsho ke 53 571 palogotlhe ya pholo ke 1 488 060.

en: Health Minister Dr. Zweli Mkhize has expressed concerns over issues around funding, human resource and leadership in the Eastern Cape Health Department.
tsn: Tona ya Boitekanelo ngaka Zweli Mkhize o tlhagisitse matshwenyego ka dintlha tse di amang matlole, batho, le boeteledipele mo Lefapheng la Boitekanelo kwa Kapa Botlhaba.

en: He also expressed satisfaction with the turnaround strategy of the Eastern Cape Health Department to improve the quality of health care services but says there are still challenges the province needs to overcome of which stem from poor leadership.
tsn: Gape o boletse fa a kgotsofaditswe ke lenaneo la togamaano la lefapha la Boitekanelo la kwa Kapa Botlhaba la go tokafatsa boleng jwa ditirelo tsa tlhokomelo ya boitekanelo, mme a re, go santse go na le dikgwetlho tse porofense e tshwanetseng go di rarabolola, tse di tlhodilweng ke boeteledipele jo bo bokoa.

en: Mkhize was in Gqeberha to assess the provinces state of readiness ahead of the mass vaccination rollout campaign.
tsn: Mkhize o ne a le kwa Qqeberha go sekaseka maemo a bosiamedi pele ga nako ya tlhagiso ya moento.

en: The Minister has noted a number of challenges in the provincial Health Department and says it is now time to focus on the basics.
tsn: Tona o etse tlhoko dikgwetlho di le mmalwa mo Lefapheng la boitekanelo la porofense mme o rile, jaanong ke nako ya go tlhoma mogopolo mo go tsa motheo.

en: During his visit, Mkhize engaged with various senior officials and stakeholders of the health department.
tsn: Ka nako ya loeto lwa gagwe, Mkhize o ile a ikgolaganya le badiredi ba bagolo le ba amegi ba ba farologaneng ba Lefapha la Boitekanelo.

en: He has admitted that health services are generally underfunded and that a shift in the demographic of diseases and an increase in population calls for a review.
tsn: O amogetse gore ditirelo tsa boitekanelo ka kakaretso ga di bone tshegetso e e lekaneng ya matlole le gore tshuto mo dipalopalong tsa malwetse le koketsego ya baagi di batla go sekasekwa.

en: There is a challenge of funding across the Eastern Cape, and we have gone through that.
tsn: Go na le dikgwetlho tsa matlole go ralala Kapa Botlhaba mme re setse re lebeletse seo

en: There is also the issue of human resources, issues of weaknesses in leadership, management, and there are also issues that relate to the infrastructure and as a result, you are finding a lot of gaps.
tsn: Gona gape le ntlha ya metswedithuso ya batho, dintlha tsa makoa mo boeteledipeleng, tsamaiso, mme gape go na le dintlha tse di amanang le mafaratlhatlha mme ka ntlha ya seo, o fitlhela diphatlha di le dintsi.

en: In the process of discussing it is clear that generally, health services are underfunded, they do need a lot of increase.
tsn: Mo thulaganyong ya go tlotla, go mo pepeneneng gore ditirelo tsa boitekanelo ga di bone matlole a a lekaneng, ba tlhoka go okelediwa thata.

en: Minister Mkhize briefs media after visiting Eastern Cape health facilities.
tsn: Tona Mkhize o bua le babegadikgang morago ga go etela mafelo a boitekanelo kwa Kapa Botlhaba.

en: Healthcare workers, affiliated with Nehawu, protested ahead of Mkhizes visit.
tsn: Badiri ba tlhokomelo ya boitekanelo ba ba nang le kgolagano le NEHAWU, ba ngongoregile pele ga loeto lwa ga Mkhize.

en: The union has expressed concerns over workers that have not yet gone back to work, following an extension of their contracts.
tsn: Setheo se tlhagisitse matshwenyego ka ga badiri ba ba iseng ba boele kwa tirong, go latela katoloso ya dikonteraka tsa bona.

en: They are also demanding a salary increase.
tsn: Ba lopa gape le kokeletso ya dituelo.

en: Addressing the workers, Regional Secretary, Sweetness Sitokwe, says their demands were being ignored.
tsn: Fa a buisana le badiri, mokwaledi wa kgaolo, Sweetness Sitokwe, a re ditlhokego tsa bona di ikgatholositswe.

en: We are demanding these posts, the healthcare workers who have been exploited; paid R3 500 without benefits we are demanding their permanence.
tsn: Re lopa ditiro tse, badiri ba tlhokomelo ya boitekanelo ba ba ntseng ba tshwerwe makgwakgwa; ba duelwa R3 500 kwa ntle ga dikabelo dipe, ba lopa go newa ditiro tse di tsepameng.

en: This is a struggle we are not willing to give up comrades.
tsn: Se ke kgwetlho e re se kitlang re e ineela mo go yona makhomoreiti.

en: We will not rest of Nehawu until we are paid our increment.
tsn: Ga re kitla re ikhutsisa NEHAWU go fitlhela re duelwa dikokeletso tsa rona.

en: It can’t be that everything else is increasing in the country, but our salaries are not increasing, says Sitokwe.
tsn: Ga e kake ya nna gore sengwe le sengwe mo nageng se a oketsegang mme dituelo tsa rona tsona ga di oketsege, go bua Sitokwe.

en: Eastern Cape Health MEC, Nomakhosazana Meth, maintains that contracts for the workers who stepped in during the peak of the COVID-19 pandemic have been extended.
tsn: MEC wa tsa boitekanelo wa kwa Kapa Botlhaba Nomakhosazana Meth, o dumela gore dikonteraka tsa badiri ba ba tseneng fa leroborobo la COVID-19 le ne le le kwa godimo, di atolositswe.

en: We still maintain that those contract workers who are falling under EPW, their contracts were extended as from the first of April, even though there were some delays that made the others to start the following week.
tsn: Re sa ntse re dumela gore badiri ba konteraka ba ba welang ka fa tlase ga EPW, dikonteraka tsa bona di ne tsa atolosiwa go tloga ka letsatsi la ntlha la kgwedi ya Moranang, le fa go ne go na le tiego e e dirileng gore ba bangwe go simolole mo bekeng e e latelang.

en: We still maintain that even those extended for three months their contracts are extended, says Meth.
tsn: Re sa ntse re dumela gore le tse di atolositsweng ka dikgwedi di le tharo, dikonteraka tsa bona di atolositswe, go bua Meth.

en: Mkhize has also applauded the work done in the Dora Nginza hospital, where he handed over a refurbished maternity ward.
tsn: Mkhize gape o akgotse tiro e e dirilweng kwa bookelong jwa Dorah Nginza, koo a ba roletseng lefelo la pelegisetso le le tlhabolotsweng.

en: He says this stems from the solid partnerships the department has established.
tsn: A re se se tswa go tirisanommogo e e tsepameng e e tlhomileweng ke Lefapha.

en: Four people died in Italy from rare blood clots after they received the AstraZeneca COVID-19 vaccine, a report from the AIFA national pharmaceutical agency said on Thursday.
tsn: Batho ba le bane ba tlhokafetse kwa Italy ka ntlha ya go rema ga madi morago ga go amogela moento wa COVID-19 wa AstraZeneca, pegelo go tswa kwa khemising ya bosetšhaba ya AIFA  e rile jalo ka Labone.

en: The AIFA report said various side-effects were seen following 0.5% of the 9.07 million doses administered between December 27 and March 26, with all three vaccines so far used, by manufacturers Pfizer, AstraZeneca and Moderna, reported to have triggered unwelcome reactions.
tsn: Pegelo ya AIFA ya re ditlamorago tse di farologaneng di ne tsa bonwa morago ga go dirisiwa ga diperesente di le 0.5 tsa meento e le dimilione di le 9.07 e e tserweng fa gare ga di 27 tsa kgwedi ya Sedimonthole le di 26 tsa kgwedi ya Mopitlwe, go fitlha ga jaana, go setse go dirisitswe meento yotlhe ka boraro jwa yona e e e dirilweng ke Pfizer, AstraZenecale Moderna, e e kailweng go nna le matswela a a sa amogelesegang.

en: Severe side-effects were registered in 0.04% of cases.
tsn: Ditlamorago tse di masisi di kwadisitswe mo dikgetseng di le 0.04%.

en: Mild side-effects have been reported after use of all three vaccines, the AIFA report said, adding most involved flu-like symptoms, pain in the injection site and tiredness.
tsn: Matshwao a a botsatsa a begilwe morago ga tiriso ya meento e meraro e, pegelo ya AIFA e buile jalo,  bontsi jwa matshwao a a tlhagelelang a akaretsa sefuba, setlhabi mo lefelong la tlhabo le letsapa.

en: Like many European countries, Italy briefly halted AstraZeneca inoculations last month when blood clot concerns surfaced.
tsn: Jaaka dinaga tse dintsi tsa kwa Europe, Italy e emisitse ka boripana meento ya AstraZeneca mo kgweding e e fetileng fa matshwenyego a go rema ga madi a sena go tlhagelela.

en: It has since resumed them for those aged 60 and above after EU regulators said the benefits outweighed the risks.
tsn: E boetse gape e tswelela ka yona go ba dingwaga di le 60 le go feta, morago ga gore balaodi ba EU ba kaye fa mesola ya yona e feta bokotsi jwa yona.

en: AIFA said there had been 11 cases in Italy of people developing one of two types of blood clots following their AstraZeneca shot cerebral venous sinus thrombosis (CVST) and thrombosis involving multiple blood vessels.
tsn: AIFA e rile go na le dikgetse di le 11 kwa Italy, tsa batho ba ba itemogelang mefuta e mebedi ya go rema ga madi morago ga go tsaya moento wa le malwetse a mangwe a a akaretsang ditshika tse di farologaneng tsa madi.

en: Four of the 11 died, it said.
tsn: Ba le bane mo go ba le 11 ba tlhokafetse, e rile jalo.

en: AstraZeneca has said it is working to understand individual cases and possible mechanisms that could explain these extremely rare events.
tsn: AstraZeneca e rile e leka go tlhaloganya dikgetse go ya batho ba ba farologaneng le ditsela tse di ka kgonang go tlhalosa ditiragalo tse di sa tlwaelegang tse.

en: Communications and Digital Technology Minister, Stella Ndabeni-Abrahams, says the digital college at Lenyenye township, outside Tzaneen in Limpopo, will help improve the digital divide in the country.
tsn: Tona ya Tlhaeletsano le Thekenoloji ya Dijithale, Stella Ndabeni-Abrahams, a re, kwa Kholetšheng ya dijithale ya kwa motsesetoropong wa Lenyenye Tzaneen kwa Limpopo, e tla thusa go tokafatsa seemo sa dijithale mo nageng ya rona.

en: The college, the first of its kind in the province,is aimed at teaching young rural communities digital technology, such as coding and robotics.
tsn: Kholetšhe, e le ya ntlha ya mofuta o mo porofenseng, e ikaelela go ruta bašwa ba metseselegae thekenoloji ya dijithale, jaaka dikhoutu le thutaroboto.

en: One of the children we found is building a robotic car that uses sensors.
tsn: Mongwe wa bana ba re ba fitlhetseng o aga koloi ya roboto e e dirisang disensara.

en: Anderson Sibanda from Lenyenye Primary School, says, My name is Anderson Sibanda.
tsn: Anderson Sibanda go tswa kwa sekolong potlana sa Lenyenye, a re, leina la me ke Anderson Sibanda.

en: When I grow up, I want to be an IT specialist.
tsn: Fa ke gola, ke batla go nna mankge wa IT.

en: Right now, I am creating a robotic car.
tsn: Ga jaana, ke tlhama koloi ya roboto.

en: It’s a car that uses batteries as electricity.
tsn: Ke koloi e e dirisang dibeteri jaaka motlakase.

en: Other unemployed young people from villages around Lenyenye are also learning about things such as cybersecurity and digital project management.
tsn: Ba bangwe ba ba botlana ba kwa metseselegaeng ya kwa Lenyenye, le bona ba ithuta ka ga dilo tse di jaaka tshireletsego ya mafaratlhatlha le tsamaiso ya porojeke ya dijithale.

en: I am learning at Cisco Networking Academy, which will be able to equip me with technology.
tsn: Ke ithuta kwa akatemi ya CISCO Networking, e e tla kgonang go nthuta ka tsa thekenoloji.

en: It is going to help me to find jobs and to pursue my career, says one youth.
tsn: E tlile go nthusa go bona ditiro le go latelela mokgele wa me, go bua mongwe wa bašwa.

en: I am Nosike Shai from Pharare Village.
tsn: Ke nna Nosike Shai go tswa kwa motseselegaeng wa Pharare.

en: I am studying Project Management and will help me to find a job.
tsn: Ke ithuta Project Management mme e tla nthusa go bona tiro.

en: A representative of the Belgium Embassy in South Africa, Dr Geraldine Reymenants says the South African economic challenges can also be solved by supporting small business enterprises investing in the digital economy.
tsn: Moemedi wa Embasi ya Belgium mo Aforikaborwa, e leng Ngaka Geraldine Reymenants a re dikgwetlho tsa ikonomi ya Aforikaborwa di ka rarabololwa ka go tshegetsa dikgwebo tse dinnye le go beeletsa mo ikonoming ya dijitale.

en: The government of Flanders (Flemish Region of Belgium) has funded the newly-opened digital college in Lenyenye to the tune of R1.5million.
tsn: Puso ya Flanders (Kgaolo ya Flemish kwa Belgium) e file kholetšhe ya dijithale e e sa tswang go bulwa kwa Lenyenye matlole a a kanang ka dimilione di le 1.5.

en: Speaking during the opening of the Vexos park Tzaneen Digital College, Minister Ndabeni-Abrahams says the country needs to invest in the digital economy for its economic standing in the global world.
tsn: Fa a ne a bua ka nako ya pulo ya Vexos Park Tzaneen kwa Kholetšheng ya dijithale, Tona Ndabeni-Abrahams re naga e tlhoka go beeletsa mo ikonoming ya dijitale ya ikonomi mo lefatsheng ka bophara.

en: (The) President recently announced that the only way to improve our economy is through investment in the digital economy and the fact of it is the vision for digital skills.
tsn: Moporesidente o begile bošeng jaana gore tsela e le nngwe fela e re ka tokafatsang ikonomi ya rona, ke go dira peeletso mo Ikonoming ya dijithale gore e kgone go ikemela lefatshe ka bophara.

en: And he talked about involving young children at a tender stage.
tsn: Mme o buile ka ga go akaretswa ga bana e sale ba ba nnye.

en: More digital colleges will, in future, be opened across the country.
tsn: Dikholetšhe tse dingwe tsa dijithale di tla bula mo isagong, go ralala naga.

en: The Africa Centres for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC) says it is monitoring updates from the US and South Africa over analysis being done on the Johnson and Johnson vaccine.
tsn: Disenthara tsa Aforika tsa Taolo le Thibelo ya malwetse (CDC) di rile di etse tlhoko tswelelopele go tswa kwa US le Aforikaborwa mo tsamaong ya tshekatsheko e e dirilweng mo moentong Johnson le Johnson.

en: Africa CDC says it continues to recommend the use of the AstraZeneca vaccine to countries across the continent as the jabs benefits outweigh the risks.
tsn: CDC Aforika ya re e tswelela go rotloetsa tiriso ya moento wa AstraZeneca go dinaga go ralala kontinente jaaka dipoelo tsa ona di feta bokotsi jwa ona.

en: I want to clarify that the process of acquiring vaccines are from limited sources.
tsn: Ke batla go tlhalosa gore thulaganyo ya go bona meento e tswa mo metsweding e e lekanyeditsweng.

en: If you look at the countries that are contributing more than 60% of the cases, they include SA, Morocco, Tunisia, Ethiopia and Egypt, he adds.
tsn: Fa o ka lebelela dinaga tse di tlisang palo ya dikgetse e e fetang 60%, di akaretsa SA, Morocco, Tunisia, Ethiopia le Egypt, a tlaleletsa.

en: AU says AstraZeneca vaccine benefits outweigh risks.
tsn: AU ya re dipoelo tsa moento wa AstraZeneca di feta go nna kotsi ga yona.

en: On vaccine production on the continent, Nkengasong says a task team is due to be set up to determine the way forward.
tsn: Mo ntshokunong ya melemo mo kontinenteng, Nkengasong a re setlhopha sa tiro se tla kopanngwa go bona tsela ya go ya pele.

en: The CDC says five centres will be developed across the continent over the next 15 years aiming to manufacture 60% of all vaccines to be used in African countries.
tsn: CDC ya re disenthara di le tlhano di tla agiwa go ralala kontinente mo dingwageng tse 15 tse di latelang ka go leka go dira diphesente di le 60 tsa meento e e tshwanetseng go dirisiwa mo dinageng tsa Aforika.

en: We really hope that the momentum that we have will enable us to use an approach to engage with 5 regions in a way that we set up the appropriate vaccine manufacturing sites.
tsn: Re solofela gore seo se re tla re kgontsha go dirisa mokgwa wa go buisana le dikgaolo tse 5 ka tsela e re tlaa tlhagisang mafelo a a maleba a go enta.

en: Our target is simple that in the next 20 years we should be able to move away from 99% of our vaccines to importing only 40%.
tsn: Maikaelelo a rona a bonolo, mme ona ke gore mo dingwageng di le 20 tse di tlang re tshwanetse go kgona go katoga 99% ya meento ya rona mme re romele 40% fela kwa ntle.

en: We should be able to manufacture about 60 per cent of our vaccines over a 20 year period of time, he says.
tsn: Re tshwanetse go kgona go dira diperesente tse 60 tsa meento ya rona mo nakong ya dingwaga tse di fetang tse 20, o bolela jalo.

en: Communications and Digital Technology Minister, Stella Ndabeni-Abrahams, is expected to officially open a digital institution, Vexospark Tzaneen Digital College, in Lenyenye township outside Tzaneen in Limpopo.
tsn: Tona ya Tlhaeletsano le thekenoloji ya dijithale, Stella Ndabeni-Abrahams, o solofetswe go bula semmuso setheo sa dijithale, Vexospark Tzaneen Digital College, kwa motsesetoropong wa Lenyenye kwa ntle ga Tzaneen kwa Limpopo.

en: The initiative is aimed at taking digital technology to rural communities as part of efforts to close the digital gender divide.
tsn: Letsholo leno le ikaeletse go isa thekenoloji ya dijitale go baagi ba kwa metsemagaeng jaaka karolo ya maiteko a go fedisa karogano ya bong ya dijithale.

en: Depression is one of the leading causes of ill health worldwide, and existing treatments are often ineffective or have adverse side effects that lead patients to stop taking them.
tsn: Kgatelelo ya maikutlo ke nngwe ya dilo tse di bakang mathata a boitekanelo mo lefatsheng ka bophara, mme kalafi e e leng teng gantsi ga e dire kgotsa e nna le ditlamorago tse di sa siamang tse di dirang gore balwetse e emise go tsaya kalafi eo.

en: Mental health is the second pandemic after COVID-19: Sadag
tsn: Boitekanelo jwa tlhaloganyo ke leroborobo la bobedi morago ga COVID-19: Sadag.

en: Carhart-Harris warned that while these findings published in the New England Journal of Medicine were encouraging, patients with depression should not try to self-medicate with magic mushrooms.
tsn: Carhart-Harris o tsibositse gore le fa diphitlhelelo tse di phasaladitsweng mo jenaleng ya melemo ya kwa England di ne di rotloetsa, balwetse ba ba nang le bolwetse jwa kgatelelo ya maikutlo ga ba a tshwanela go leka go ithekela melemo ka bobona.

en: That would be an error of judgment, he said.
tsn: Seo e tlaa nna phoso ya katlholo, a rialo.

en: The research involved 59 patients with moderate to severe depression who got either a high dose of psilocybin and a placebo, or escitalopram plus a dose of psilocybin so low as to be classed as non-active and unlikely to have an effect.
tsn: Dipatlisiso di akareditse balwetse ba le 59 ba ba nang le matshwao a a mo bogareng le a a kwa godimo a kgatelelo ya maikutlo, ba ba amogetseng melemo ya psilocybin le placebo, kgotsa escitalopram e e nang le psilocybin e e kwa tlase e e se kitlang e nna matswela.

en: This design was aimed at ensuring the two arms of the trial were as alike as possible for those taking part.
tsn: Popo e ne e totile go netefatsa gore go nna le dibetsa tsa tekelelo e ne e le ka go tshwana jaaka go kgonega go ba tsaya karolo.

en: Carhart-Harris said participants reports suggested the psilocybin had a more fundamental effect than antidepressants.
tsn: Carhart-Harris a re dipoelo tsa batsayakarolo di tsitsinnya gore psilocybin ne e le botlhokwa thata go feta di antidepressants tse dingwe.

en: I think it’s getting more at the root causes of suffering, he said.
tsn: Ke akanya gore e simolola go tlhagisa mabaka a tshotlego, o buile jalo.

en: The Imperial team, co-led by David Nutt, a professor of neuropsychopharmacology, has been exploring the potential of psilocybin for many years.
tsn: Setlhopha sa imperial, se se tsamaisiwang ke David Nutt, Moporofesara wa neuropsychopharmacology, se ntse se leka go tlhotlhomisa bokgoni jwa psilocybin mo dingwageng tse dintsi.

en: In 2016, they published a small study showing psilocybin could help ease a severe condition known as treatment-resistant depression.
tsn: Ka ngwaga wa 2016, ba phasaladitse patlisiso e nnye e e bontshang gore psilocybin e ka thusa go fokotsa seemo se se tseneletseng se se itsegeng jaaka treatment-resistant depression.

en: Members of a US health panel on Wednesday voiced concern over resuming vaccinations with Johnson & Johnsons COVID-19 shot, even as a US Food and Drug Administration scientist said warnings could mitigate the risk of rare but serious blood clots.
tsn: Maloko a phanele ya boitekanelo ya kwa US ka Laboraro ba tlhagisitse matshwenyego a go busetswa ga mokento wa COVID-19 wa Johnson & Johnsons, le morago ga gore rasaense wa tsamaiso ya dijo le diritibatsi wa kwa US a buile gore go tsibosa batho go ka kgona go fokotsa kgonagalo ya kotsi ya go rema ga madi e e masisi.

en: The panel is reviewing six reported cases of rare brain blood clots in women who received the J&J vaccine, a day after federal regulators paused its use to assess the issue.
tsn: Phanele e sekaseka dikgetsi tse di begilweng di le thataro tsa go rema ga madi mo bobokong jwa basadi ba ba amogetseng moento wa J & J, letsatsi morago ga gore bofederale ba emise tiriso ya ona go sekaseka morero.

en: South Africa has recorded 1 599 new coronavirus infections in the last 24-hour cycle, taking the total number to 1 561 559.
tsn: Aforikaborwa e tshwanetse go rekotiwa 1 599 coronavirus ditshwaetsego tse dintšhwa mo di fetileng, go nna le palogotlhe ya go 1 561 559.......

en: The country has also recorded 75 new COVID-19 related fatalities on Wednesday.
tsn: Naga e rekotile dintsho tsa COVID-19 tse di ntšhwa di le 75 tse di amanang le COVID-19 ka Laboraro.

en: This brings the total number of deaths to 53 498.
tsn: Se se tlisa palogotlhe ya dintsho go 53 498.

en: On 3 May, we will receive 325 260 vaccines, says Mkhize.
tsn: Ka di 3 Motsheganong, re tla amogela meento e le 325 260 meento, go bua Mkhize.

en: Yesterday, the Health Minister said the country is temporarily halting the use of the J&J vaccine due to cases of blood clotting reported in the US.
tsn: Maabane, Tona ya boitekanelo Tona o rile naga e emisitse nakwana tiriso ya moento wa J & J ka ntlha ya dikgetse tse di begilweng kwa US tsa go rema ga madi.

en: Government pauses Johnson Johnson vaccine rollout.
tsn: Puso e kgaotsa go ntshiwa ga moento wa Johnson & Johnson.

en: Mkhize also called on the public not to panic following the announcement that the rollout of the Johnson & Johnson has been suspended in South Africa
tsn: Mkhize o ikopetse mo setšhabemg gore se seka sa tshosiwa ke kitsiso ya gore tlhagiso ya Johnson & Johnson e emisitswe mo Aforikaborwa.

en: Mkhize says the issue will be cleared in a few days’ time, Its precautionary halting.
tsn: Mkhize a re kgang e e tlaa rarabolwa mo nakong ya matsatsi a le mmalwa, Ke dikgato tsa nakwana tsa kelotlhoko.

en: Its not like we are closing down on Johnson and Johnson.
tsn: Ga e se gore re tswala moento wa Johnson & Johnson.

en: As soon as the information is made available, we are quite certain that we should move on.
tsn: Fa tshedimosetso e sena go nna teng, re na le bonnete jwa gore re tshwanetse go tswelela.

en: It might take a couple of days to resume but at this point, we think it might be the best way to deal with it.
tsn: Go ka tsaya malatsi a le mmalwa gore re tswelele mme mo nakong e, re akanya gore e ka nna tsela e e siameng ya go samagana nayo.

en: The Co-Chair of the Ministerial Advisory Committee on COVID-19, Barry Schoub, has sought to explain potential reasons behind the rare occurrence of blood clots forming following the administering of a vaccine.
tsn: Motlatsamodulasetulo wa Komiti ya Bodiredi ya COVID-19, Barry Schoub, o lekile go tlhalosa mabaka a a ka nnang teng, a a bakang tiragalo ya go rema ga madi e e latelang morago ga go tsaya moento.

en: This after the US Food and Drug Administration (FDA)said that six cases of rare blood clotting were detected, following the rollout of more than6.8million doses of the Johnson and Johnson vaccine.
tsn: Se, se latela morago ga gore tsamaiso ya dijo le diritibatsi ya kwa US (FDA) e kaye gore go fitlhetswe dikgetse di le thataro tse di kgethegileng tsa go rema ga madi, go latela go ntshiwa ga meento ya Johnson & Johnson e e fetang dimilione di le 6.8.

en: South Africa has also paused its use, although no cases of blood clots have been reported in the country.
tsn: Aforikaborwa le yona e emisitse tiriso ya yona, le fa e le gore ga go dikgetse tsa go rema ga madi tse di begilweng mo nageng.

en: Nearly 300000 healthcare workers have already received the one-shot vaccine in SA.
tsn: Badiri ba tlhokomelo ya boitekanelo ba ka nna 300000 ba setse ba amogetse moento e le mongwe mo Aforikaborwa.

en: Schoub says investigations are ongoing to determine whether there is the possibility of the vaccine causing blood clots.
tsn: Schoub a re dipatlisiso di tsweletse go tlhomamisa gore a go na le kgonego ya gore moento o baka go rema ga madi.

en: There is the one thing that is being investigated, both the AstraZeneca and J&J are using what is called the Adenovirus vector, which is fairly harmless and is quite prevalent and that is used to carry the gene, or the vector, which is used to stimulate the immune response for protection.
tsn: Go na le selo se le sengwe se se batlisisiwang, AstraZeneca le J & J ba dirisa se se bidiwang Adenovirus vector, e e se nang bokotsi bope mme e e itsegeng thata e bile e dirisetswa go rwala jini, kgotsa veketara, e e dirisiwang go etleetsa a tsibogo ya tshireletso.

en: It is that particular vector that seeks to carry the Adenovirus which is being looked at.
tsn: Ke yona veketara e e rileng eo, e e batlang go rwala Adenovirus e e lebeletsweng.

en: Could that possibly be what is triggering these clots?
tsn: A se e ka nna sona se se dirang gore go nne le go rema ga madi?

en: But I must emphasize that at this stage, there is no evidence that these clots are related to the vaccine.
tsn: Mme ke tshwanetse go gatelela gore mo nakong eno, ga go na bosupi jwa gore go rema ga madi go amana le moento.

en: This is just something that is being investigated at the moment.
tsn: Se ke sengwe fela se se batlisisiwang ka nako e.

en: Experts unpack South Africa’s halting for the Johnson & Johnson COVID-19 vaccine.
tsn: Bomankge ba tlhalosa go emisiwa ga moento wa COVID- 19 mo Aforikaborwa.

en: FDA findings are not supposed to be taken lightly.
tsn: Diphitlhelelo tsa FDA ga di a tshwanela go tsewa botlhofo.

en: Health Minister Dr Zweli Mkhize says that findings of the FDA in recommending that the J&J COVID-19 vaccine rollout be halted must not be taken lightly.
tsn: Tona ya boitekanelo Ngaka Zweli Mkhize, a re diphitlhelelo tsa FDA tse di tsitsinyang gore go ntshiwa ga moento wa COVID-19 wa J & J go emisiwe, ga di a tshwanela go tsewa botlhofo.

en: After this advisory came to my attention, I held urgent consultations with our scientists, who have advised that we cannot take the decision made by the FDA lightly.
tsn: Morago ga go utlwa ka kgakololo eno, ke ne ka nna le ditherisano tsa tshoganyetso le borrasaense ba rona, ba ba re gakolotseng gore ga re a tshwanela go tsaya tshwetso e e dirilweng ke FDA botlhofo.

en: Based on their advice, we have determined to voluntarily suspend our rollout until the causal relationship between the development of clots and the Johnson and Johnson vaccine is sufficiently interrogated, he adds.
tsn: Re ikaegilwe ka kgakololo ya bona, re tsere tshwetso ya emisa nakwana go ntshiwa ga moento go fitlhelela kamano fa gare ga go baka go rema ga madi moento wa le Johnson & Johnson di botsolotswa mo go utlwalang, a tlaleletsa.

en: Mkhize says the South African Health Products Regulatory Authority (SAHPRA) will gather information from J&J, FDA and other regulatory bodies to thoroughly assess the situation before advising government regarding the vaccine.
tsn: Mkhize a re bothati jwa Taolo jwa tsa boitekanelo mo Aforikaborwa (SAHPRA) e tla kokoanya tshedimosetso go tswa kwa J & J, FDA le mekgatlho e mengwe go sekaseka maemo pele go gakololwa puso malebana le meento.

en: Mkhize hopes suspension of the rollout is temporary.
tsn: Mkhize o solofela gore go emisiwa ga go ntshiwa ga meento ke selo sa nakwana.

en: The US Centres for Disease Control Advisory Committee on Immunisation Practices is expected to meet on Wednesday to discuss these developments, while the FDA launches an investigation.
tsn: Komiti ya kgakololo ya disenthara tsa Taolo ya malwetse kwa US e solofetswe go kopana ka Laboraro go buisana ka ga ditiragalo tse, fa FDA yona e tlaa simolola ka dipatlisiso.

en: Both agencies say its important for the healthcare provider community to be aware of the potential for these adverse events.
tsn: Ditheo tse ka bobedi di a re go botlhokwa gore batlamedi ba tlhokomelo ya boitekanelo ba nne le kitso ka ga kgonego ya ditiragalo tse di sa siamang.

en: SABC News Correspondent Sherwin Bryce-Pease unpacks the decision by the USA to suspend the roll out of the Johnson &JohnsonCOVID-19 vaccine.
tsn: Mmegadikgang wa SABC Sherwin Bryce-Pease o tlhalosa ka ga tshwetso ya USA ya go emisa go ntshiwa ga moento wa COVID-19 wa Johnson & Johnson.

en: The role of SAHPRA as the regulatory authority is to look at the safety, quality and efficacy of all medicines in the public interest and safety is always at the top of that list.
tsn: Seabe sa sahpra jaaka bothati jwa Taolo jwa tsa boitekanelo ke go lebelela pabalesego, boleng le bokgoni jwa melemo mo kgatlhegong ya setšhaba mme polokesego ke yona e e botlhokwa thata.

en: That is why we are paying attention globally to any safety signals at all and being very cautious.
tsn: Ke ka moo re tsepamisang mogopolo mo go nngwe le nngwe ya makhubu a pabalesego le go nna kelotlhoko thata.

en: We will have a discussion once we understood whether there is a causal link with these rare side effects or there is not, says Professor Rees.
tsn: Re tla nna le puisano fa re sena go tlhaloganya gore a go na le kgolagano mo dikgetse tse di kgethegileng tse kgotsa ga e yo, go bua Moporof Rees.

en: SAMA supports decision to halt rollout.
tsn: SAMA tshegetsa tshwetso ya go emisiwa ga go ntshiwa ga meento.

en: Meanwhile, South African Medical Association (SAMA) Chairperson Dr Angelique Coetzee says, Yes, it is good for the minister to temporarily halt the vaccination rollout for at least 24-48 hours while we gather some more information.
tsn: Re sa ntse re le foo, Modulasetulo wa South African Medical Association (SAMA)  Ngaka Angelique Coetzee a re, ee, go molemo gore Tona a emise nakwana go ntshiwa ga moento  sebaka di ura di le 24 go ya go go di le 48, fa re ntse re kokoanya tshedimosetso e nngwe.

en: One also needs to look at the six people who claimed it was due to the J&J vaccine out of more than six million.
tsn: Re tlhoka gape go lebelela batho ba le barataro ba ba kayang gore e ne e le ka ntlha ya moento wa J & J mo go ba ba fetang dimilione di le thataro.

en: In medicine terms, that is a very small number.
tsn: Fa re bua ka tsa boitekanelo, ke palo e nnye thata eo.

en: One needs to always measure it up to what is for the better, added Coetzee.
tsn: O tlhoka go lekanya ka metlha le se se leng botoka, go tlaleletsa Coetzee.

en: Dr Angelique Coetzee on Morning Live.
tsn: Ngaka Angelique Coetzee o kwa Morning Live.

en: Mkhize has called on the public not to panic following the announcement that the rollout of the Johnson & Johnson has been suspended in South Africa.
tsn: Mkhize o ikuetse go setšhaba gore se seke sa tshoga go latela kitsiso ya gore tlhagiso ya Johnson & Johnson e emisitswe mo Aforikaborwa.

en: EFF Calls For Immediate Halt
tsn: EFF e ikuela gore o emisa ka yona nako eo.

en: One of the women died and another one is in critical condition in hospital.
tsn: Mongwe wa basadi o tlhokafetse fa yo mongwe a le mo maemong a a masisi kwa bookelong.

en: An outbreak of Avian influenza has been detected on a chicken farm in Ekurhuleni, east of Johannesburg, where around 300 birds died.
tsn: Go tsoga ga mokgotlhwane wa Avian go lemogilwe kwa polaseng ya dikgogo kwa Ekurhuleni, botlhaba jwa Johannesburg, kwa go fitlhetsweng gona dikgogo di le 300 di sule.

en: Spokesperson for the Department of Agriculture, Land Reform and Rural Development, Reggie Ngcobo, says samples were sent to Onderstepoorts Veterinary Research facility and tested positive for the H5 strain of Avian flu.
tsn: Sebueledi sa Lefapha la Bolemirui le Tlhabololo ya Magae le Kabosešwa ya Lefatshe, Reggie Ngcobo, a re di ne tsa romelwa kwa setheong sa patlisiso ya leruo kwa Onderstepoorts mme tsa fitlhelwa di na le mokgotlhwane wa Avian wa H5.

en: He says the commercial chicken-layer farm was also part of the H5N8 highly pathogenic avian influenza (HPAI) outbreak in 2017.
tsn: A re polase e ya dikgogo e ne e le karolo ya mokgotlhwane wa Avian wa H5N8 (HPAI) ka ngwaga wa 2017.

en: The outbreak caused poultry farmers to cull millions of birds and prompted neighbouring countries including Zimbabwe, Namibia and Botswana to ban poultry imports from South Africa.
tsn: Tlhagogo e e dirile gore balemirui ba dikgogo ba fokotse dimilione tsa dinonyane mme ba kopa dinaga tse di mabapi tse di akaretsang Zimbabwe, Namibia le Botswana gore ba seke ba amogela dikgogo tse di romelwang go tswa mo Aforikaborwa.

en: Ngcobo says the farm has been placed under quarantine.
tsn: Ngcobo re polase e kgapetswe kwa thoko.

en: He says veterinary authorities are investigating the extent of the outbreak and the nature of the pathogen.
tsn: A re digaka tsa diphologolo di batlisisa tsenelelo ya tlhagogo le mofuta wa mogare.

en: We urge our people to (remain) calm.
tsn: Re ikuela go batho ba rona gore ba dige makgwafo.

en: There is no need for panic.
tsn: Ga go tshokege gore ba tshoge.

en: We urge our farmers as well as those who keep birds for hobbies or in zoos.
tsn: Re rotloetsa balemirui ba rona mmogo le bao ba tshwarang dinonyane gore ba di dirisetse go tshameka ka tsona kgotsa kgotsa ba di ise kwa dizuu.

en: Keep birds away from areas that are visited by wild birds, control access of people that come in, in their bird houses, avoid provision of water and food in a way that attracts wild birds.
tsn: Tlosa dinonyane mo dikgaolong tse di etelwang ke dinonyane tse di tlhaga, laola go tsena ga batho mo matlong a bona a dinonyane, tila go tlamela ka dijo le metsi ka tsela e e ngokang dinonyane tse di tlhaga.

en: The Department is currently working on making sure that we get the result and then we will be able to advise accordingly, adds Ngcobo.
tsn: Lefapha ga jaana le dira ka natla go netefatsa gore re bona dipholo mme re tlaa kgona go ntsha dikgakololo tse di tshwanetseng, go tlaleletsa Ngcobo.

en: Ex-combatants from liberation movements affiliated to different political parties are playing a significant role in fighting poverty through agricultural programmes in the Eastern Capes O R Tambo region.
tsn: Balwela kgololosego ba maloba go tswa mo mekgatlho ya kgololesego e e amanang le makoko a sepolotiki a a farologaneng ba tshameka  karolo e e botlhokwa thata mo go lwantsheng botlhoki ka mananeo a temothuo mo kgaolong ya Kapa Botlhaba ya OR Tambo.

en: They are working on eight hectares of land that produces quality potatoes at kwaMbiza village outside Ngqeleni.
tsn: Ba dira mo tshimong ya diheketara tse robedi e e ntshang ditapole kwa motseng wa kwaMbiza kwa ntle ga Ngqeleni.

en: Through the municipality’s financial injection, the project has also created jobs for the unemployed youth.
tsn: Ka ketleetso ya matlole go tswa kwa masepala, porojeke e ne gape ya tlholela bašwa ba ba sa direng ditiro.

en: OR Tambo Mayor, Thokozile Sokhanyile, has described this as an outstanding project.
tsn: Ratoropo wa OR Tambo, Thokozile sokhanyile, o tlhalositse porojeke e jaaka porojeke e e tswileng diatla.

en: It’s a project that is meant for those people that were fighting for this freedom and those people are from the military’s veterans of the MK, SANDF and the others whereby, we have said that they must come up with the project and they came up with these potatoes, says Sokhanyile.
tsn: Ke porojeke e e diretsweng batho ba ba neng ba lwela kgololosego  mme batho bao ke bagaka ba MK, SANDF le ba bangwe ba e rileng fa re kopa gore ba tle ka porojeke ba tla ka ditapole tse, go bua Sokhanyile.

en: Such projects assist with food security.
tsn: Diporojeke tsa mofuta o di thusa ka tshireletsego ya dijo.

en: Those involved in this project say feeding the poor is their priority.
tsn: Ba ba amegang mo porojekeng e ba re go tlamela batho ba ba humanegileng ka dijo go botlhokwa mo go bona.

en: Jongilizwe Mpokwana, one of them, says, Since we are the former soldiers, when we came back from the bush we learnt something, like to produce some potatoes.
tsn: Jongilizwe Mpokwana, mongwe wa bone, a re, jaaka re le masole a maloba, fa re boa kwa sekgweng re ithutile sengwe, jaaka go lema ditapole.

en: So far, we are happy we learnt.
tsn: Go fitlha ga jaana, re itumelela gore re ithutile.

en: I am very much happy.
tsn: Ke itumetse thata.

en: Xoliswa Mpongwana’s late father spent years in exile.
tsn: Rraagwe Xoliswa Mpongwana, yo a tlogetseng lefatshe le le ka kwano o dutse dingwaga di le dintsi kwa botshwarwa.

en: He also played a part in the formation of the potato co-operative before he passed on.
tsn: Le ena o nnile le seabe mo tshimolong ya temo ya ditapole pele ga a tlhokafala.

en: Mpongwana says at least her father left them with skills to till the land.
tsn: Mpongwana re bobotlana rraagwe o ba tlogetse ka bokgoni jwa go lema lefatshe.

en: So far, I have learnt that utilising the soil is much better because there are no more jobs now.
tsn: Go fitlha ga jaana, ke ithutile gore go dirisa mmu go botoka ka gonne ga go tlhole go na le ditiro.

en: People have lost jobs due to COVID-19.
tsn: Batho ba latlhegetswe ke ditiro ka ntlha ya COVID-19.

en: So, by using this soil, which our father left us with, I think we are going to live for the future, she says.
tsn: Ka jalo, ka go dirisa mmu o, o rre a re tlogeletseng ona, ke akanya gore re tlile go tshela mo isagweng, o bua jalo.

en: The participants in the project aim to get into commercial farming.
tsn: Batsayakarolo mo porojekeng ba na le maikaelelo a go tsena mo kgwebong ya bolemirui

en: Mayor Sokhanyile says, locally, the market is doing well as potatoes are in demand.
tsn: Mmeyara sokhanyile a re, mo gae, mmaraka o dira sentle thata gonne ditapole di a batlega.

en: After reaping these potatoes, they will go to the fresh Kie produce market, where they would be sorted and washed and there is a market already.
tsn: Fa re sena go kotula ditapole tse, di tlaa ya kwa mmarakeng, koo ba tla di tlhaolang le go di tlhatswa mme di tla rekisiwa.

en: There are people who are going to take these potatoes.
tsn: Go na le batho ba ba tlileng go tsaya ditapole tse.

en: So, even the village here, the people are assisting and they are going to get skills necessary, adds the Mayor.
tsn: Ka jalo, le mo motseng mo, batho ba a thusa e bile ba tlile go fitlhelela dikgono tse di tlhokegang, go tlaleletsa meyara.

en: The former freedom fighters want to venture into commercial farming and are hoping for more land to realise their dream amid fencing, transport and farming equipment challenges.
tsn: Balwela-kgololesego ba maloba ba batla go tsena mo kgwebong ya bolemirui  mme ba solofela go bona lefatshe go fitlhelela toro ya bona gareng ga dikgwetlho tsa fense, dipalangwa le didiriswa.

en: Authorities have made it mandatory for all people entering the area to take COVID-19 tests.
tsn: Bothati bo dirile taolelo ya gore batho botlhe ba ba tsenang mo lefelong leo ba tsay diteko tsa COVID-19.

en: But many devotees on Sunday gathered by the river without masks, in densely packed crowds.
tsn: Fela bontsi jwa baineedi ka Latshipi ba ne ba kgobokane kwa nokeng kwa ntle ga Dimaseke, go tletse matshwititshwiti a batho.

en: Chinas top disease control official has said the country is formally considering mixing COVID-19 vaccines, as a way of further boosting vaccine efficacy.
tsn: Motsaisi wa Taolo ya malwetse kwa China a re naga e akanya ka go tlhakatlhakanya meento ya COVID-19, jaaka mokgwa wa go oketsa kgono ya melemo.

en: Available data shows Chinese vaccines lag behind others including Pfizer and Moderna in terms of efficacy, but require less stringent temperature controls during storage.
tsn: Tshedimosetso e e leng teng e bontsha gore meento ya kwa China e saletse kwa morago mo go e mengwe e e akararetsang Pfizer le Moderna fa go lebeletswe bokgoni, mme ga e tlhoke maemo a a rileng a thempereitšha kwa e bolokiwang teng.

en: The currently available vaccines don’t have very high rates of protection, Gao Fu, the director of the Chinese Centers for Disease Control and Prevention, told a conference in the Chinese city of Chengdu on Saturday.
tsn: Meento e e leng teng ga jaanong jaana e na le dielo tse di kwa godimo tsa tshireletso, Gao Fu, Mokaedi wa ditikatikwe tsa go laola malwetse le thibelo kwa China, o buile jalo kwa khonferenseng kwa toropong ya Chengdu kwa China ka Lamatlhatso.

en: Inoculation using vaccines of different technical lines is being considered, he said.
tsn: Kento ya go dirisa meento ya setegeniki e e farologaneng e a akanngwa, a rialo.

en: A COVID-19 vaccine developed by Chinas Sinovac was found to have an efficacy rate of slightly above 50% in Brazilian clinical trials.
tsn: Moento wa COVID-19 o o tlhamilweng ke Sinovac ya wa China o lemogilwe o na le kgono e e kwa godimonyana ga 50% kwa ditekong tsa setliniki tsa kwa Brazil.

en: A separate study in Turkey said it was 83.5% effective.
tsn: Patlisiso e e kwa thoko ya kwa Turkey e rile o na le kgona ya 83.5%.

en: No detailed efficacy data has been released on a vaccines made by Chinas Sinopharm.
tsn: Ga go na tshedimosetso e e tletseng e e golotsweng ka ga meento e e dirilweng kwa Sinopharm kwa China.

en: It has said two vaccines developed by its units are 79.4% and 72.5% effective respectively, based on interim results.
tsn: E rile  meento e mebedi e e tlhamilweng ke yuniti ya yona e na le kgono e e kana ka 79.4% le 72.5 %, go ikaegilwe ka dipholo tsa nakwana.

en: Both vaccine makers have presented data on their COVID-19 vaccines indicating levels of efficacy in line with those required by the World Health Organization, a WHO panel said in March.
tsn: Badiri ba meento e ka bobedi ba na le tshedimosetso ka ga meento ya bona ya COVID-19 e e supang kgono ya go tsamaelana le tseo di tlhokwang ke World Health Organisation, ba Phanele ya WHO ba buile jalo ka Mopitlwe.

en: China has shipped millions of its vaccines abroad, and officials and state media have fiercely defended the shots while calling into question the safety and logistics capabilities of other vaccines.
tsn: China e rometse dimilione tsa meento ya yona kwa moseja, mme batlhankedi ba puso ba dirile ka natla go sireletsa meento e, le fa ba ne ba botsa dipotso ka ga pabalesego le bokgoni jwa meento e mengwe.

en: Health Minister Zweli Mkhize recently announced that the country has secured more than 50-million vaccine doses from pharmaceutical giants, Pfizer and Johnson & Johnson.
tsn: Tona ya Boitekanelo Zweli Mkhize o dirile kitsiso bošeng jaana gore naga e fitlhetse meento e e ka fetang dimilione di le 50 go tswa kwa  dikhemising tse di kgolo, Pfizer le Johnson & Johnson.

en: Delivery is expected to begin later this month.
tsn: Thebolelo ya ditirelo e solofetswe go simolola moragonyana mo kgweding eno.

en: More than 50 million doses of COVID-19 vaccines secured for SA.
tsn: Meento ya COVID-19 e feta dimilione di le 50 di ntse di ka COVID-19 e gorogile mo SA.

en: SAHPRAs Chairperson Professor Helen Rees says the side effects are extremely rare.
tsn: Modulasetulo wa SAHPRA Moporofesara Helen Rees a re ditlamorago ke tse di tlwaelegang.

en: I think people desperately want to get back to normal.
tsn: Ke akanya gore batho ba ka batla go boela kwa tlwaelong.

en: They want to have their normal social life back and we are not going to be able to do that
tsn: Ba batla go boela kwa matshelong a bona a a tlwaelegileng mme re ka se kgone go dira jalo.

en: We are going to be sitting with masks and distancing and limited numbers in facilities if we don’t get the vaccine out there.
tsn: Re tlile go dula ka dimaseke, go katogana le palo e e lekanyeditsweng kwa mafelong fa re sa ise meento kwa bathong.

en: What we are saying to everyone is we are monitoring for rare side effects.
tsn: Se re se buang go mongwe le mongwe ke re etse tlhoko ditlamorago tse di sa tlwaelegang.

en: Will we see a few?
tsn: A re tlaa bona di le mmalwa?

en: Probably with the different vaccines we might do well, but to emphasize, they are extremely rare and what we talk about then is benefit-risk to protect the community and to get society back going again
tsn: Gongwe ka meento e e farologaneng re ka dira sentle, mme go gatelela, mme se re buang ka sona ke go sireletsa baagi le go dira gore setšhaba se tswelele ka matshelo a sona gape.

en: What is that benefit versus the risk of these extremely rare side effects?
tsn: Dipoelo tse di kana kang fa di bapisiwa le bokotsi jwa ditlamorago tse di kgethegileng tse?

en: Update on the investigation into the use of AstraZeneca vaccine: Stuart Smith
tsn: Go itsise ka ga patlisiso ya tiriso ya moento wa AstraZeneca: Stuart Smith

en: Over 100-million vaccine doses have been administered across the Asian country by the end of March this year.
tsn: Meento e feta dimilione di le 100 e rebotswe kwa nageng ya Asia kwa bokhutlong jwa Mopitlwe monongwaga.

en: Former KwaZulu-Natal journalist Zanele Buthelezi who now lives in Beijing, China, received her jab recently.
tsn: Mmegadikgang wa maloba wa kwa KwaZulu-Natal Zanele Buthelezi yo ga jaana a dulang kwa Beijing, China, o amogetse moento bošeng jaana.

en: She spoke to SABC News reporter, Genevieve Lanka, about the strides the country has made in nearly eradicating its local coronavirus transmissions.
tsn: O ne a bua le mmegadikgang wa SABC, Genevieve Lanka ka matsapa a a tserweng ke naga go fedisa go tshwaetsana ka mogare wa Corona.

en: Wuhan marks a year since hard lockdown
tsn: Wuhan e fetsa ngwaga e le ka fa tlase ga kiletsomesepele.

en: In January 2020, when news that there was an outbreak of a novel virus in the central Chinese city of Wuhan dominated headlines, Zanele was on holiday in Durban.
tsn: Ka kgwedi ya Ferikgong 2020, fa dikgang tsa go runya ga mogare kwa toropong ya Wuhan kwa China di ne di tlhagelela, Zanele o ne a le kwa malatsing a boikhutso kwa Durban.

en: It was on the news and seeing all the major mainstream media houses reporting on this virus that has been raging in China, I left scared like because I still had to go back to China at that time.
tsn: E ne e le mo dikgannyeng mme e rile go bona bobegadikgang bo go bega ka ga mogare o o tlhasetseng kwa China, ke ne ka boifa gonne ke ne ke tshwanetse ke go boela kwa China ka nako eo.

en: Getting to my apartment I had to take like a 40-day quarantine period and being in the house, but then I ran out of food.
tsn: Fa ke fitlha kwa ntlong ya me ke ne ka tshwanelwa ke go nna matsatsi a le 40 ke ikgapetse kwa thoko le go nna mo ntlong, mme ke ne ka felelwa ke dijo.

en: So I had a lot of anxiety at the beginning of COVID-19 here in China.
tsn: Ka jalo ke nnile le ketsaetsego e ntsi thata fa COVID-19 e ne e simolola mo China.

en: At the start of the pandemic in the country, China responded with a strong arm.
tsn: Kwa tshimologong ya leroborobo la mo nageng, China e ne ya ikarabela ka letsogo le le maatla.

en: A year later, Zanele says the city is thriving.
tsn: Ngwaga morago ga moo, Zanele a re toropo eo e dira sentle thata.

en: And now the reports that we are getting from that City is that its a vibrant city, people have come back, the tourists have come back, businesses have reopened.
tsn: Mme jaanong dipegelo tse re di bonang go tswa kwa toropong eo ke gore ke toropo e e tletseng botshelo, batho ba boetse kwa go yona, bajanala ba boile, dikgwebo di butswe.

en: China started its vaccination programme in December 2020.
tsn: China e simolotse lenaneo la go entiwa ka 2020.

en: The country has set up over 74 000 vaccination sites in 15 regions.
tsn: Naga e baakantse mafelo a le 74 000 a go enta mo dikgaolong di le 15.

en: Zanele is among the millions of residents who have received the COVID-19 vaccination.
tsn: Zanele ke mongwe wa baagi ba le dimilione ba ba amogetseng moento wa COVID-19.

en: She, together with a group of foreign nationals, were allowed to vaccinate in Beijing this week.
tsn: Ena, mmogo le setlhopha sa baditšhaba, ba ne ba letlelewa go enta kwa Beijing mo bekeng eno.

en: Zanele says the process was simple and efficient.
tsn: Zanele re thulaganyo e ne e le bonolo mme e nonofile.

en: It started with just confirming your information, checking your social security card, where they took down all your details.
tsn: E simolotse ka go netefatsa tshedimosetso ya gago, go netefatsa karata ya gago ya tshireletso ya loago, kwa ba neng ba kwalolola tshedimotsetso ya gago yotlhe teng.

en: Then we had to sign the consent form which informs you of the risks and it tells you that the vaccine that you are about to receive, the case we were about to receive and in this case we were getting the sinovac vaccine, which is developed here in China.
tsn: Morago ga moo re ne ra tshwanelwa ke go saena foromo ya tumelelo e e go itseseng ka dikotsi le go go bolelela ka moento o o tlileng go o amogela, ka nako eo re ne re amogela moento wa Sinovac, o o tlhamilweng mo China.

en: All of the vaccines that are being administered are being developed here in China.
tsn: Meento yotlhe e e tsamaisiwang e tlhamilwe gona mo China.

en: China is using two types of vaccines in its rollout programme  sinovac and sinopharm.
tsn: China e dirisa mefuta e mebedi ya meento e e dirisiwang mo lenaneong la go enta,  Sinovac le Sinopharm.

en: Both have been developed in China.
tsn: Bobedi jwa yona bo tlhamilwe kwa China.

en: Debates around the safety and efficacy of vaccines have not evaded Zanele, however, she says there is a different kind of anxiety involved when you face the jab.
tsn: Dingangisano ka pabalesego le tshireletsego ya meento ga di ise di lebalesege mo go Zanele, le fa go ntse jalo, a re go na le ketsaetsego e nngwe e o nnang le yona fa o lebagane le go tsaya moento.

en: I was a little bit anxious.
tsn: Ke ne ke tlhobaela go le gonnye.

en: I am not a fan of needles.
tsn: Ga ke motho yo o ratang dinalete.

en: I do brave it out, you know  when I have to.
tsn: Ke ne ke le pelokgale, waitse fa o tshwanetse go dira selo.

en: Ya, I didn’t even feel the injection going in.
tsn: Ee, ga ke a utlwa le fa nalete e tsena.

en: I looked away
tsn: Ke ile ka lebelela kwa thoko.

en: I didn’t even feel it because it was so small, it was quick.
tsn: Ga ke a e utlwa go nne e le nnye e bile e le ka bonako.

en: Not a lot of bleeding and I didnt feel any pain I must say when the doctor or when the health care worker administered the vaccine in my arm.
tsn: Ga ke a dutla madi a mantsi, ga ke a ikutlwa ke le mo botlhokong bope fa ngaka kgotsa modiri wa tlhokomelo ya boitekanelo a ne a tlhaba moento mo letsogong lame.

en: Zanele says observation is an important part of the process, and health care workers are on hand to monitor any possible side effects.
tsn: Zanele a re o lemogile gore kelotlhoko ke karolo e e botlhokwa ya tsamaiso mme badiri ba tlhokomelo ya boitekanelo ba dula ba le teng go baya ditlamorago tse di ka nnang teng leitlho.

en: After getting the shot, we had to go to an observation area across from where you get your shot.
tsn: Morago ga go entiwa, re ne ra tshwanelwa ke go ya kwa lefelong la kelotlhoko gaufi le kwa re entilweng gona.

en: You go and sit for about thirty minutes, where they are just observing you and monitoring whether you are having any adverse reactions to the vaccine or not.
tsn: O ya go nna metsotso e ka nna 30, kwa ba tla bong ba etse tlhoko gona gore moento o go tshwere sentle kgotsa nnyaa.

en: Most of the people there were just sitting.
tsn: Bontsi jwa batho koo bo ne bo ituletse fela.

en: There weren’t any reactions to the vaccine from my observation as I was sitting for that thirty minutes that I had to wait.
tsn: Ga go a nna le ditlamorago dipe tsa moento go ya ka moo ke boneng ka teng fa ke ne ke letile metsotso e le 30 e ke neng ke tshwaetse ke go e leta.

en: There were a lot of I guess volunteers, medical doctors around so we were being monitored I guess, properly.
tsn: Go ne go na le baithaopi ba le bantsi, dingaka tsa kalafi ka jalo re ne re tlhokometswe sentle, ka tshwanelo.

en: People were answering your questions when you had questions.
tsn: Batho ba ne ba araba dipotso tsa gago fa o ne o na le tsona.

en: Before leaving the massive vaccination camp, Zanele was given a strict set of protocols.
tsn: Pele ga go tsamaya kwa kampeng ya moento, Zanele o ne a newa melao e e gagametseng ya tlhokomelo.

en: They just said avoid alcohol, don’t consume any alcohol, which is easy for me because I don’t drink alcohol.
tsn: Ba rile efoga go nwa bojalwa, o seke wa nwa bojalwa bope, se se neng se le bonolo mo go nna gonne ga  ke nwe bojalwa.

en: Also, don’t eat spicy food and seafood.
tsn: Gape, ga ke je dijo tse di nang le pepere le dijo tsa lewatle.

en: Not to take a shower for the next 24hours.
tsn: Go se tlhape mo diureng di le 24 tse di latelang.

en: I just had to brave it out with the sweat and everything, because people were a little sweaty.
tsn: Ke ne ke tshwanetse go nna pelokgale, mofufutso le sengwe le sengwe, ka gonne batho ba a fufula.

en: China has made significant strides in fighting the COVID-19 pandemic within its borders.
tsn: China e dirile kgatelopele e e bonalang mo go lwantsheng leroborobo la COVID-19 mo melelwaneng ya yona.

en: By April 9th, only 14 cases were reported all of which from international travellers.
tsn: Ka di 9 tsa Moranang, ke dikgetse di le 14 fela tse di neng di begilwe tsotlhe tse go tswa go batsayaloeto ba kwa dinageng di sele.

en: Zanele says this success is attributed to both the governments swift and hard response, and the compliance of its citizenry.
tsn: Zanele re katlego e e fitlheletswe ke ke dipuso le go ikarabela ka thata, le kobamelo ya baagi.

en: We may have looked at those measures as being you know, cruel or very harsh.
tsn: Re ka tswa re ne le lebeletse dikgato tseo jaaka bosetlhogo le go tsholwa makgwakgwa thata.

en: But it shows that the intention was that to control the pandemic and make sure that it does not spread too far out of that particular area.
tsn: Mme se se bontsha gore maikaelelo e ne e le go laola leroborobo le go netefatsa gore ga le anamele kgakala le kwa ntle ga tikologo e e rileng.

en: Another thing that worked was the compliance that the Chinese people showed at that time.
tsn: Se sengwe se se se dirileng ke tirisanommogo e batho ba kwa China ba e bontshitseng ka nako eo.

en: They were willing to listen to what the government was saying and they stayed in their homes.
tsn: Ba ne ba ikemiseditse go reetsa se puso e se buang mme bad ula kwa magaeng a bona.

en: Reporting by Genevieve Lanka
tsn: Pego ka Genevieve Lanka.

en: A magnitude 5.9 earthquake off Indonesia’s Java Island on Saturday killed one person and damaged buildings in several cities, media reports said.
tsn: Thoromo ya lefatshe e e bogolo jwa 5.9 kwa setlhaketlhake sa Java kwa Asia ka Lamatlhatso e bolaile motho a mongwe le go senya dikago kwa ditoropong di le mmalwa, dipegelo tsa bobegakgang di buile jalo.

en: The quake was felt in cities and towns across East Java, home to 40.7 million people, and nearby provinces, including the resort island of Bali, Indonesian media reported.
tsn: Thoromo e e ne e utlwala kwa ditoropokgolo le ditoropo tsa go kgabaganya Botlhaba jwa Java, legae go batho ba le dimilione di le 40.7, le diporofense tse di mabapi, go akaretsa setlhakatlhake sa Bali, Indonesia. Bobegakgang bo begile.

en: One person died in Lumajang after being hit by a falling boulder, news website Detik.com said, citing a town disaster official.
tsn: Motho a le mongwe a tlhokafetse kwa Lumajang morago ga go wela ke letlapa le le neng le wa, dikgang tsa webosaete Detik.com di begile jalo, di nopola modiredi wa toropo.

en: Reports of damage included parliamentary buildings, a school, a hospital and houses in several cities, while a large gorilla statue in an amusement park in the town of Batu lost its head.
tsn: Dipegelo tsa tshenyo di akaretsa dikago tsa palamente, sekolo, bookelong le dintlo kwa ditoropong le mmalwa, fa sefikantswe se se golo sa tshwene kwa phakeng e e kwa toropong ya Batu se latlhegetswe ke tlhogo ya sona.

en: The national disaster agency said authorities were still taking stock of the damage.
tsn: Balaodi ba Setheo sa matlhotlhapelo a bosetšhaba ba ne ba sa ntse ba tsaya setoko ya tshenyo.

en: The quake struck in the Indian Ocean 91 km (57 miles) off the southern coast of East Java.
tsn: Thoromo e e otlile mo lewatleng la kwa India, dikolometara di le 90 (dimmaele di le 57 ) mo Borwa Botlhaba jwa kwa Java.

en: It had a magnitude of 5.9 at a depth of 96 km, the European-Mediterranean Seismological Centre said, after initially saying the magnitude was 6.8.
tsn: E ne e le bogolo jwa 5.9 mo botennye jwa dikilometara di le 96, European-Mediterranean center e buile jalo, morago ga go bua kwa tshimologong gore e ne e le bogolo jwa 6.8...

en: Video shared by social media users showed people running out of a shopping mall in Malang city amid the strong tremor.
tsn: Bidio e e neng e bontshiwa mo mmedieng wa botsalano e bontshitse batho ba tswa ba taboga ka mo gare ga mmolo kwa toropong ya Malang fa go ne go na le thoromo.

en: I felt the earthquake twice, the first time for two seconds and then it stopped, but then it shook again for five seconds, Edo Afizal, a receptionist at a hotel in Blitar, told Reuters by phone.
tsn: Ke utlwile thoromo e gabedi, la ntlha metsotswana e le mebedi mme ya emisa, mme morago ga moo ga roroma gape metsotswana e le metlhano, Edo Afizal, modiri kwa hoteleng ya kwa Blitar, o boleletse Reuters ka mogala.

en: As of today, the total number of confirmed #COVID19 cases is 1 556 242 the total number of deaths is 53 226 the total number of recoveries is 1 481 637 and the total number of vaccines administered is 288 368.
tsn: Gompieno jaana, palogotlhe ya dikgetse tsa COVID-19 ke 1 242 556 Palogotlhe ya dintsho ke 53 226 palogotlhe ya pholo ke 1 481 637 mme palogotlhe ya meento e e tsamaisitsweng ke 288 368.

en: Deputy Minister in the Presidency, Thembi Siweya, says she is satisfied with the rolling out of the COVID-19 vaccination programme in Mpumalanga.
tsn: Motlatsa Tona mo kantorong ya Moporesitente, Thembi Siweya, a re o kgotsofetse ka kitsiso ya lenaneo la go entiwa la COVID-19 kwa Mpumalanga.

en: Siweya visited the Shongwe Hospital to monitor the state of readiness for Phase 2 of the provinces vaccination programme.
tsn: Shongwe siweya ba go tlhokomela maemo a bosiamedi ya Legato la 2 la Lenaneo la go entiwa ya diporofense.

en: She was accompanied by the MEC for Health, Sasekani Manzini.
tsn: O ne a tsamaya le Mokhuduthamaga wa Boitekanelo, Sasekani Manzini.

en: Shongwe Hospital is one of the COVID-19 vaccination sites in Mpumalanga.
tsn: Bookelong jwa Shongwe ke nngwe ya mafelo a moento wa COVID-19 mo Mpumalanga.

en: Currently, the programme is focusing on frontline workers.
tsn: Ga jaana, lenaneo le le lebelela pele badiri.

en: About 16 000 of the more than 51 000 healthcare workers in the province have been vaccinated so far.
tsn: Badiri ba tlhokomelo ya boitekanelo ba ka nna 16 000 mo go ba ba fetang 51 000 mo porofenseng ba setse ba amogetse moento ga jaana.

en: The province is waiting for more vaccines so it can continue with the first phase of the programme.
tsn: Porofense e emetse  meento e mengwe gore e kgone go tswelela ka kgato ya ntlha ya lenaneo.

en: Most of the frontline workers have welcomed the programme and they say the vaccination will ease their anxiety of contracting COVID-19.
tsn: Bontsi jwa badiri ba amogetse lenaneo la go entiwa mme ba re le tla thusa go fokotsa tlhobaelo ya go tshwaetswa ke COVID-19.

en: Mpumalanga has so far recorded more than 64 000 COVID -19 cases with more than 1 300 fatalities.
tsn: Mpumalanga ga jaana e rekotile dikgetse tsa COVID-19 tse di fetang 64 000 le dintsho tse di ka fetang 1 300.

en: I am very much delighted although sometimes there is that fear about the side effects.
tsn: Ke itumetse thata gore le fa ka dinako tse dingwe go nna le letshogo la gore go tla nna le ditlamorago.

en: I have seen some of my colleagues.
tsn: Ke setse ke bone bangwe ba badirammogo le nna.

en: They have (been) vaccinated and there are no side effects.
tsn: Ba tsere moento moento mme ga ba a itemogela ditlamorago dipe.

en: I am willing to take that risk.
